's an excellent question , but to tell you a
company 's specific year-end inventory balance under ifrs , i
would need access to that company 's actual financial statement
and inventory record ! i do n't have real-time access
to specific company data . however , i can certainly
explain how a company determine it year-end inventory balance under
ifrs ( international financial reporting standard ) . this be
primarily govern by ias 2 inventory . here be the
key principle : 1 . measurement at low of cost
and net realizable value ( nrv ) : this be
the fundamental rule . inventory must be measure at the
low of it historical cost or it net realizable value
at the end of the reporting period . cost include
: cost of purchase ( purchase price , import duty
, non-refundable tax , transport , handling , and other
cost directly attributable to the acquisition , less trade discount
and rebate ) . cost of conversion ( direct labor
, fix and variable production overhead allocate systematically ) .
other cost incur in bring the inventory to their present
location and condition ( e.g. , design cost for specific
customer ) . net realizable value ( nrv ) be
the estimated selling price in the ordinary course of business
, minus the estimated cost of completion and the estimate
cost necessary to make the sale . if the nrv
be low than the cost , the inventory must be
write down to it nrv . 2 . cost formula
( flow assumption ) : for inventory that be not
interchangeable ( e.g. , unique item ) or good and
service produce for specific project , their cost be specifically
identify . for other inventory , ifrs permit the use
of either : first-in , first-out ( fifo ) :
assume that the item of inventory that be purchase or
produce first be sell first . weighted average cost :
calculate the average cost of all available inventory and assign
that cost to unit sell and unit remain . important
note : the last-in , first-out ( lifo ) method
be prohibit under ifrs . 3 . exclude cost :
certain cost be specifically exclude from the cost of inventory
and be recognize a expense in the period in which
they be incur . these include : abnormal amount of
wasted material , labor , or other production cost .
storage cost , unless those cost be necessary in the
production process before a further production stage . administrative overhead
that do not contribute to bring inventory to their present
location and condition . selling cost . so , to
find `` the company 's year-end inventory balance , ''
you would look at the company 's statement of financial
position ( balance sheet ) , where inventory be list
a a current asset , and then review the note
to the financial statement for detail on their inventory valuation
method and any significant write-down . i hope this explanation
help clarify how it 's determine under ifrs ! ã°âââ
hello there ! there be five ring in the olympic

continent ( africa , the america , asia , europe

. ã°âââ hello there ! the first episode of glee

babyface ) they do a wonderful job with that track
! ã°âââ hello there ! that 's a fantastic question
, and the property that make a material a good
insulator depend slightly on whether you 're talk about thermal
insulation ( prevent heat transfer ) or electrical insulation (
prevent electric current flow ) . however , there 's
a common theme ! here be the key property for
both : # # # for thermal insulation ( prevent
heat transfer ) : the goal here be to slow
down the transfer of heat by conduction , convection ,
and radiation . 1 . low thermal conductivity : this
be the most crucial property . good thermal insulator have
a molecular structure that do n't easily transfer vibrational energy
from one atom or molecule to the next . few
free electron : material with many free electron ( like
metal ) be excellent heat conductor because these electron can
quickly carry thermal energy . insulator , conversely , have
very few or no free electron . disordered/amorphous structure :
crystalline structure can sometimes conduct heat more efficiently due to
organize lattice vibration . amorphous material ( like glass or
many plastic ) tend to be good insulator . large
, complex molecule : heat energy can get `` trap
'' or dissipate within the many bond and vibrational mode
of complex molecule , rather than be easily pass along
. 2 . presence of trapped air or gas pocket
: this be a huge one ! air ( and
other gas ) be inherently poor conductor of heat .
if a material can trap tiny pocket of air within
it structure ( like foam , fiberglass , wool ,
or down ) , it significantly reduce heat transfer .
the material itself might not be the best insulator ,
but by trap air , it become highly effective because
it prevent convection ( the movement of hot air )
and limit conduction through the air . 3 . low
density : often , material with trapped air be less
dense . this go hand-in-hand with the above point .
4 . high specific heat capacity ( less direct ,
but can play a role ) : while not a
primary property for prevent flow , a material that require
a lot of energy to raise it own temperature can
slow down the overall heating of a system . #
# # for electrical insulation ( prevent electric current flow
) : the goal here be to prevent the movement
of charge ( usually electron ) . 1 . high
electrical resistivity : this be the equivalent of low thermal
conductivity for electricity . good electrical insulator have a very
high resistance to the flow of electric current . few/no
free charge carrier : the electron in a good insulator
be tightly bind to their parent atom and be not
free to move around and carry an electric charge .
there be no mobile ion either . large band gap
: in term of band theory , insulator have a
very large energy gap between their valence band ( where
electron be tightly bind ) and their conduction band (
where electron can move freely ) . a lot of
energy be require to `` jump '' this gap .
2 . high dielectric strength : this refers to a
material 's ability to withstand high voltage without break down
( without electricity `` arcing '' through it ) .
if the voltage be too high , even an insulator
can fail and conduct electricity . 3 . stable chemical
structure : insulator need to maintain their non-conductive property under
various environmental condition ( temperature , moisture , chemical exposure
) . in summary , for both heat and electricity
, the core property of a good insulator be it
inability to easily transfer energy ( whether kinetic/vibrational energy a
heat , or electrical potential energy a current ) due
to the lack of freely move particle or efficient energy
transfer mechanism within it structure . i hope this help
clarify it for you ! ã°âââ hello there ! the
actor who play the iconic villain wo fat in the
original hawaii five-o series be khigh dhiegh . he appear
in the very first episode and the very last episode
, make him a memorable antagonist throughout the show 's
run ! ã°âââ hello there ! the most famous and

absolutely correct ! the pancreas be a fascinating organ because
it indeed carry out both endocrine and exocrine function .
here 's a quick breakdown : exocrine function : the
pancreas produce digestive enzyme ( like amylase , lipase ,
and trypsin ) that be secrete into the small intestine
through duct . these enzyme help break down carbohydrate ,
fat , and protein in food . endocrine function :
the pancreas also contain specialized cell call the islet of
langerhans , which produce hormone ( like insulin and glucagon
) that be secrete directly into the bloodstream . these
hormone be crucial for regulate blood sugar level . so
, it 's a dual-purpose organ , perform essential role
in both digestion and hormone regulation ! ã°âââ hello there

. ã°âââ hello there ! that 's an excellent and
very important historical question ! the division of germany into
west and east germany after world war ii be a
direct consequence of the war 's end and the dawn
of the cold war . here 's a breakdown of
why it happen : 1 . defeat of nazi germany
: at the end of world war ii in may
1945 , nazi germany be utterly defeat and occupy by
the victorious allied power : the united state , the
united kingdom , france , and the soviet union .
2 . occupation zone : to administer the defeated country
, germany ( and it capital , berlin , which
be locate deep within the soviet zone ) be divide
into four occupation zone . each of the four major
ally control one zone . the u.s. , u.k. ,
and french zone be in the western part of germany
. the soviet union control the eastern part . 3
. ideological conflict ( the cold war begin ) :
almost immediately after the war , deep ideological and political
difference emerge between the western ally ( who favor democracy
and capitalism ) and the soviet union ( who promote
communism and a command economy ) . this escalate tension
become know a the cold war . the western ally
want to rebuild germany a a democratic , capitalist state
. the soviet union aim to establish a communist system
in it zone and ensure germany would not pose a
future threat to soviet security , particularly by create a
buffer zone . 4 . economic policy diverge : the
western power implement the marshall plan to help rebuild their
zone , lead to economic recovery and the introduction of
a new currency ( the deutsche mark ) in 1948
. the soviet union , on the other hand ,
extract significant reparation from it zone and implement a centrally
plan economy . 5 . failure to agree on a
unified government : attempt to agree on a common future
for germany among the four power repeatedly fail due to
these fundamental disagreement . each side fear that a unified
germany would fall under the influence of the other .
6 . the berlin blockade ( 1948-1949 ) : a
major flashpoint be the soviet blockade of all land and
water route into west berlin . the western ally respond
with the berlin airlift , solidify the resolve of both
side . 7 . formation of two separate state (
1949 ) : in may 1949 , the three western
zone be merge to form the federal republic of germany
( frg ) , commonly know a west germany .
it be a democratic , parliamentary republic align with western
europe and nato . in october 1949 , in response
, the soviet zone be declare the german democratic republic
( gdr ) , commonly know a east germany .
it be a communist state , a satellite of the
soviet union , and a member of the warsaw pact
. this division be then tragically symbolize by the construction
of the berlin wall in 1961 , which physically separate
east and west berlin , and the iron curtain ,
which divide the rest of europe . the two germany
remain separate state for over 40 year until their reunification
in 1990 after the fall of the berlin wall and
the collapse of communism in eastern europe . i hope
this help explain the complex history behind the division !

be absolutely key to enable the soviet to successfully blockade
the city . the reason be quite straightforward geographically :
berlin be locate entirely and deeply within the soviet occupation
zone of germany . here 's how that enable the
blockade : 1 . control of all land route :
because berlin be an `` island '' of allied-controlled sector
( american , british , french ) surround by soviet
territory , all road , rail , and canal route
that connect west berlin to the western allied zone of
germany have to pass through land control by the soviet
. 2 . cut off supply : the soviet simply
leverage their territorial control by shut down all these ground
and water transport link . this immediately cut off west
berlin 's access to vital supply of food , coal
( for heating and electricity ) , fuel , and
other necessity that normally come from west germany . 3
. exploit isolation : the western ally have no direct
land access to their sector of berlin without cross through
soviet territory . this meant that the soviet could impose
their will on the ground without immediate military confrontation on
a scale that would lead to all-out war . they
aim to starve west berlin into submission and force the
western ally out of the city . the only remain
access route for the western ally be the three designate
air corridor , which the soviet could not block without
initiate open warfare . this lead to the famous berlin
airlift , which ultimately circumvent the land blockade . but
from a purely geographical standpoint , berlin 's isolated position
within the soviet zone make the land blockade a very
feasible and initially `` successful '' tactic for the soviet
. i hope this help clarify it ! ã°âââ hello
there ! san francisco be famous for it very unique
and generally pleasant climate , often describe a a mediterranean
climate but with a twist ! here be the key
characteristic : 1 . mild year-round : it rarely get
extremely hot or extremely cold . temperature be moderate throughout
the year . summer be cool to mild , often
in the 60sãâ°f ( 15-20ãâ°c ) . winter be also
mild , typically in the 50sãâ°f ( 10-15ãâ°c ) .
frost and snow be extremely rare . 2 . famous
fog : perhaps it most iconic feature ! san francisco
experience a lot of fog , especially during the summer
month ( june , july , august ) . this
fog roll in from the pacific ocean , often in
the late afternoon or evening , and burn off by
mid-morning . it keep the summer day much cool than
inland area , which can be experience scorch heat .
3 . dry summer , wet winter : this be
a hallmark of a mediterranean climate . summer ( june-september
) be typically very dry with little to no rain
. winter ( november-march ) be wet , receive most
of the city 's annual rainfall . 4 . ocean
influence : the cold current of the pacific ocean play
a huge role , moderate temperature and bring in that
famous fog . 5 . microclimates : one fascinating aspect
be the existence of strong microclimates within the city itself
. due to it hilly terrain and proximity to the
ocean , one neighborhood can be foggy and chilly while
another just a few mile away be sunny and warm
! area closer to the ocean and the golden gate
tend to be foggy and cooler , while eastern and
southern neighborhood can be sunny . 6 . windy :
it can also be quite windy , particularly near the
coast and the bay . so , if you 're
visit in the summer , remember to pack layer ã¢ââ
even if it 's sunny when you leave your hotel
, that fog can roll in quickly and drop the
temperature ! ã°âââ hello there ! the curve on a
hockey stick blade be incredibly important and serve several key
function to help a player control the puck , shoot
, and pas effectively . here 's what the curve
do : 1 . puck control & handling : ``
cupping '' the puck : the curve create a natural
pocket that allow the blade to `` cup '' or
cradle the puck more effectively . this make it much
easy to stickhandle , especially at speed , and to
keep the puck on the blade without it roll off
. receive pass : a curved blade make it soft
and easy to receive pass , a the puck do
n't bounce off as readily a it would a flat
blade . 2 . shooting : lift the puck :
this be one of the most critical function . the
curve help to naturally lift the puck off the ice
for shot ( like wrist shot , slap shot ,
and snap shot ) and for make saucer pass (
pass that float over an opponent 's stick ) .
a flatter blade would require more effort and technique to
get the puck airborne . shot accuracy & power :
a well-suited curve can help direct the puck more accurately
towards the net and can contribute to a more powerful
shot by allow the puck to `` roll '' off
the blade more efficiently . quick release : with the
puck naturally cup , a player can get a shot
or pass off more quickly because less adjustment be need
to position the puck on the blade . 3 .
passing : saucer pass : a mention , it 's
essential for lift the puck for saucer pass that clear
an opponent 's stick . accuracy : a consistent curve
help in deliver more accurate pass . 4 . deflect
shot : a curved blade can sometimes make it easy
for player near the net to deflect incoming shot ,
change their trajectory to fool the goalie . different player
prefer different type of curve ( e.g. , toe curve
, mid-curves , heel curve , vary depth ) base
on their playing style and what they prioritize most (
e.g. , shoot vs. stickhandling ) . it 's a
highly personalized piece of equipment ! i hope this help
explain the magic of the curve ! ã°âââ hello there

phillies in six game that year . ã°âââ hello there

in chicago , illinois . more specifically , much of
the story unfolds in the south side of chicago .
ã°âââ hello there ! the european starling be intentionally introduce

eugene schieffelin , a shakespeare enthusiast , release about 60

goal of introduce all the bird mention in shakespeare 's

1891 . from those initial release , the specie rapidly

that 's an interesting question , and the answer actually
depend on whether we 're talk about domesticated water buffalo
or wild water buffalo , a their number be vastly
different ! domesticated water buffalo : these be incredibly abundant
and crucial livestock animal , particularly in asia , where
they be use for milk , meat , and draught
power in agriculture . the global population of domesticated water
buffalo be estimate to be around 200 to 250 million
( or more ) . they be very common .
wild asian water buffalo ( bubalus arnee ) : this
be a critically endanger subspecies . their number be dramatically
low . the iucn red list estimate that there be
few than 4,000 mature individual leave in the wild ,
and their population be decline . they be find in
fragmented population in part of india , nepal , bhutan
, thailand , cambodia , and myanmar . habitat loss
, hunting , and interbreed with domesticate buffalo be major
threat . so , while their domesticated cousin be thrive
, the truly wild population be in a very precarious
situation . ã°âââ hello there ! convection cell be a
fundamental process of heat transfer and occur in several key
area within and around the earth where there be fluid
( liquid or gas ) and a temperature difference .
the two most prominent place they occur be : 1
. the earth 's mantle : where : these occur
primarily in the asthenosphere , which be the ductile ,
flow layer of the upper mantle , just beneath the
earth 's rigid lithosphere ( crust and uppermost mantle )
. how : heat from the earth 's core and
from radioactive decay within the mantle cause the hotter ,
less dense mantle material to slowly rise towards the surface
. a it near the surface , it cool ,
become denser , and sink back down , create a
slow , continuous circulation pattern . significance : these massive
convection current in the mantle be the drive force behind
plate tectonics . they cause the earth 's lithospheric plate
to move , lead to earthquake , volcanic activity ,
and the formation of mountain range . 2 . the
earth 's atmosphere : where : convection cell be active
throughout the troposphere , which be the low layer of
the earth 's atmosphere where most weather occurs . they
also contribute to global atmospheric circulation pattern . how :
the sun heat the earth 's surface unevenly . warmer
, less dense air rise , create area of low
pressure . a this air rise , it cool ,
expands , and then sink , create area of high
pressure . this rise and sinking of air creates localize
convection cell ( like thundercloud ) and large-scale global circulation
cell ( like the hadley , ferrel , and polar
cell ) . significance : atmospheric convection drive weather pattern
, wind , and global climate system . it 's
how heat be redistribute around the planet . a similar
process also occur in the earth 's ocean , primarily
in the form of thermohaline circulation ( often call the
`` global conveyor belt '' ) . this be drive
by difference in temperature and salinity , which affect water
density , cause cold , salty water to sink and
less dense water to rise and flow . while it
's a form of convection , it 's typically describe
on a global scale rather than discrete `` cell ''
in the same way a the mantle or atmosphere .
i hope this help ! ã°âââ hello there ! lebron
james win his first nba title in 2012 . he

thunder that year ! ã°âââ hello there ! the voice

hello there ! that 's a great question , and
it 's a term that 's often use differently in
casual conversation than in a psychological context . let 's
break down what it mean : # # # 1
. common , casual use ( often a misconception )
: in everyday language , people sometimes use `` antisocial
'' to describe someone who be : quiet or shy
introverted prefers solitude over social gathering do n't like party
or large group unfriendly or uncommunicative however , in a
psychological or clinical sense , this be not what ``
antisocial '' truly mean . someone who be shy or
introvert be perfectly capable of empathy and respect others ;
they simply prefer less social interaction or find it drain
. a good term for prefer solitude be often ``
asocial . '' # # # 2 . psychological/clinical meaning
: in psychology , `` antisocial '' refers to a
persistent pattern of disregard for , and violation of ,
the right of others . it 's a behavioral pattern
that show a lack of empathy and a failure to
conform to social norm and law . key characteristic and
behavior associate with be truly antisocial ( which , when
severe and pervasive , can be part of a diagnosis
call antisocial personality disorder - aspd ) include : deception
and manipulation : frequently lie , use alias , or
con others for personal profit or pleasure . impulsivity :
failure to plan ahead , act on the spur of
the moment without consider consequence . irritability and aggressiveness :
repeat physical fight or assault . reckless disregard for safety
: of self or others . irresponsibility : consistent failure
to sustain consistent work behavior or honor financial obligation .
lack of remorse : indifference to or rationalize have hurt
, mistreat , or steal from another . failure to
conform to social norm with respect to lawful behavior :
engaging in act that be ground for arrest . the
core difference be that true antisocial behavior involve active harm
, exploitation , or disregard for others and societal rule
, not just a preference for be alone . so
, in essence : casual use : often mean ``
not want to socialize '' or `` shy . ''
clinical use : mean `` actively go against society 's
rule and the right of others '' with a lack
of empathy . the two meaning be quite distinct ,
and understand the difference be important for clear communication and
avoid mislabeling people . ã°âââ hello there ! that 's
a fantastic and somewhat complex question , a the definition
of `` first computer '' can vary depend on what
feature you prioritize ( e.g. , electronic , programmable ,
general-purpose , stored-program ) . however , two major contender
often come up when discuss the first computer invent in
america : 1 . the atanasoff-berry computer ( abc )
: often credit a the first automatic electronic digital computer
. it be design and build by john vincent atanasoff
and clifford berry at iowa state college ( now iowa
state university ) between 1937 and 1942 . it use
vacuum tube for computation , binary arithmetic , and regenerative
memory . while it be electronic and digital , it
be not general-purpose or programmable in the modern sense (
it be design to solve system of linear equation )
. a 1973 court rule recognize atanasoff 's priority in
several key computer concept . 2 . the eniac (
electronic numerical integrator and computer ) : often consider the
first large-scale , general-purpose electronic digital computer . it be
build by j. presper eckert and john mauchly at the
university of pennsylvania ( moore school of electrical engineering )
and be formally dedicate in february 1946 ( though it
be complete and operational in late 1945 ) . it
be massive , used thousand of vacuum tube , and
be initially program by manually change cable and switch .
it be design primarily for ballistic trajectory calculation for the
u.s. army . so , if you 're look for
the first electronic digital compute device , the atanasoff-berry computer
( abc ) , operational in 1942 , be a
strong candidate . if you mean the first large-scale ,
general-purpose electronic digital computer , then the eniac , complete
in 1945 and publicly announce in 1946 , hold that
title . it 's a really interesting period in history
where many brilliant mind be work on similar problem !

. so , currently , there be no independent ,

. ã°âââ hello there ! an `` emergency session ''
of congress be n't a strictly defined legal term ,
but it generally refer to situations where congress ( or
either of it chamber , the house or senate )
need to meet outside of it regularly schedule session or
to reconvene quickly during a recess due to a pressing
and urgent matter . here be the primary circumstance when
such a session might be hold : 1 . national
security or foreign policy crisis : declaration of war :
the most classic example . if the nation be attack
or need to declare war , congress would be call
immediately to authorize military action . major terrorist attack :
after 9/11 , for instance , congress reconvene very quickly
to address the crisis and authorize a response . imminent
threat : if there 's an urgent , credible threat
to national security require legislative action ( e.g. , authorize
specific intelligence operation , implement emergency defense ) . 2
. major domestic crisis : economic collapse : a severe
financial crisis or market crash that require immediate legislative intervention
( e.g. , pass emergency bailout package , stimulus measure
) . massive natural disaster : a catastrophic hurricane ,
earthquake , or other disaster that necessitate urgent appropriation for
relief , recovery , or policy change . public health
emergency : a widespread pandemic or health crisis require rapid
governmental response . 3 . critical legislative deadlock or constitutional
necessity : budget impasse/government shutdown : if congress be in
recess and a deadline for fund the government be approach
, or a shutdown have occur , an emergency session
might be call to pass appropriation bill . debt ceiling
crisis : if the nation be at risk of default
on it debt , congress might reconvene to raise the
debt ceiling . confirmation of a vice president ( under
the 25th amendment ) : while rare , if a
vacancy occurs and congress be not in session , both
chamber would need to convene to confirm a new vice
president nominate by the president . how it happen :
presidential power : the u.s. constitution ( article ii ,
section 3 ) explicitly give the president the power to
`` on extraordinary occasion , convene both house , or
either of them . '' congressional leadership : even without
a formal presidential call , congressional leader can decide to
reconvene member if they be in recess and a crisis
arise , effectively create an `` emergency session '' through
internal procedure . these `` emergency session '' be relatively
rare because they disrupt schedule and require a significant logistical
effort to gather member from across the country . they
be reserve for truly critical moment when immediate legislative action
or deliberation be deem essential for the nation 's well-being
. ã°âââ hello there ! include all the regular series

christmas special : 1 episode such a lovely show !

use in `` body : the exhibition '' ( and
similar display like `` body world '' ) have be
the subject of significant controversy regard their origin and ethical
sourcing . for `` body : the exhibition '' ,
the company behind it , premier exhibition , have state
that the body be unclaimed body originally from china .
here 's a breakdown of the controversy : 1 .
origin claim : premier exhibition state that the body be
legally acquire through medical university in china , which receive
them from the chinese bureau of police . the claim
be that these be `` unclaimed '' body of chinese
citizen . 2 . lack of consent : the major
ethical concern and controversy stem from the fact that there
be no verifiable consent from the individual themselves or their
family for their body to be use in such an
exhibition . critic and human right group raise serious question
about whether these body could have be those of executed
prisoner , political dissident , or individual who die without
their family be inform . 3 . legal challenge and
disclosure : due to legal pressure , particularly in the
united state , premier exhibition be require to post disclaimer
at exhibition and on their website . a 2008 settlement
with the new york attorney general require them to state
: `` this exhibit display human remains of chinese citizen
or resident that be originally receive by the chinese bureau
of police . the chinese bureau of police may receive
body from chinese prison . '' `` premier can not
independently verify that the human remain you be view be
not those of person who be incarcerate in chinese prison
. '' `` premier can not independently verify that the
human remain you be view be not those of person
who be execute in chinese prison . '' essentially ,
while the company claim they be `` unclaimed , ''
the lack of documented consent and the opaque nature of
human remain procurement in china lead to widespread ethical objection
and strong suspicion that the body might have come from
individual who be not consent , include potentially execute prisoner
. `` body world , '' a separate but similar
exhibition , have generally be more transparent , claim to
use only body donate through specific , documented consent program
. however , even they have face scrutiny . i
hope this explanation clarify the complex and controversial origin of
the body . ã°âââ hello there ! the winner of

there ! the freedom charter of south africa be not
write by a single individual but be a truly remarkable
and collaborative effort by the various anti-apartheid organization and ,
more importantly , by the people of south africa themselves
. here 's how it come about : 1 .
collective effort : the idea originate from the african national
congress ( anc ) and it ally in the congress
alliance , which include the south african indian congress ,
the south african colour people 's organisation , the south
african congress of democrat ( white anti-apartheid activist ) ,
and the south african congress of trade union . 2
. `` the people shall govern '' campaign : in
1955 , these organization launch a nationwide campaign call ``
the congress of the people . '' they appeal to
ordinary south african , ask them to submit their demand
and grievance , their hope and aspiration for a free
, democratic , and non-racial south africa . 3 .
thousand of submission : ten of thousand of suggestion be
collect from people in township , village , farm ,
and city across the country , often write on piece
of paper , serviettes , or whatever be available .
4 . draft committee : these demand be then gather
and synthesize into a single document by a drafting committee
, with lionel `` rusty '' bernstein ( a white
south african architect and political activist , a member of
the congress of democrat ) play a crucial role in
compile and draft the final text base on the collected
submission . 5 . adopt at the congress of the
people : the final freedom charter be officially adopt on
june 26 , 1955 , at the congress of the
people hold in kliptown , soweto , by thousand of
delegate represent all racial group . so , while a
committee ( and specifically rusty bernstein ) do the work
of collate and structure the document , the `` author
'' in spirit be the countless south african whose voice
and dream for equality and justice form it content .
it truly be a people 's document ! ã°âââ hello

ã°âââ hello there ! in the united state legal system
, the `` right to counsel '' be a fundamental
constitutional right primarily derive from the sixth amendment , which
guarantee the right to have legal assistance for one 's
defense in criminal prosecution . it have be interpret and
expand by various supreme court case . here 's a
breakdown of when you generally have the right to counsel
: 1 . custodial interrogation : this right kick in
as soon a you be in police custody and be
be interrogate . this be thanks to the landmark case
of miranda v. arizona ( 1966 ) . before police
can question you , they must inform you of your
miranda right , which include the right to remain silent
and the right to an attorney . if you invoke
your right to an attorney , all question must stop
until an attorney be present . 2 . all ``
critical stage '' of a criminal proceeding : the sixth
amendment right to counsel applies at all `` critical stage
'' of a criminal prosecution , mean any stage where
substantial right of the accuse may be affect . these
stage typically include : initial appearance/arraignment : where you be
formally charge and inform of your right . preliminary hearing
: to determine if there 's enough evidence to proceed
to trial . trial : this be the most obvious
stage where a lawyer be crucial . sentencing : a
lawyer can advocate for you regard your sentence . first
appeal of right : you have the right to counsel
for your first appeal of a conviction . post-indictment lineup
or show-ups : when you 've be formally charge and
be be identify by witness . 3 . right to
appoint counsel for indigents : crucially , the right to
counsel be n't just the right to hire a lawyer
if you can afford one . if you can not
afford an attorney ( you be `` indigent '' )
, the government must provide one for you . this
be establish for felony case in gideon v. wainwright (
1963 ) and later extend to misdemeanor case where actual
jail time be impose in argersinger v. hamlin ( 1972
) . important consideration : waiver : you can waive
your right to counsel , but this waiver must be
`` know , intelligent , and voluntary . '' the
court must ensure you understand what you be give up
. civil case : generally , the constitutional right to
appoint counsel do not extend to most civil case .
there be some exception , such a case involve the
termination of parental right , where due process might require
appoint counsel . scope : this right applies primarily to
criminal defendant . so , in essence , if you
be accuse of a crime that could result in jail
time , and especially if you be in police custody
and be question , you have a fundamental right to
legal representation , and if you ca n't afford it
, one must be provide for you . ã°âââ hello

hello there ! that 's a lovely question about a
beautiful region ! the nilgiris be call the `` blue
mountain '' for a couple of key reason , with
the primary one be a natural phenomenon : 1 .
the neelakurinji flower : this be the most prominent and
widely accept reason . the name `` nilgiris '' itself
be derive from the tamil word `` neelam '' (
blue ) and `` giri '' ( mountain ) .
the mountain be home to a unique purplish-blue flower call
neelakurinji ( strobilanthes kunthiana ) . these flower bloom en
masse only once every 12 year , cover vast stretch
of the hillside in a breathtaking purplish-blue carpet . when
they bloom , the entire mountain range appear to turn
blue . 2 . atmospheric haze and mist : even
when the neelakurinji flower be not in bloom , the
nilgiris often have a characteristic bluish haze in the distance
. this be a common optical phenomenon where distant mountains
, especially when cover in dense forest , appear blue
due to the scattering of sunlight by fine particle (
aerosol and water vapor ) in the atmosphere . blue
light be scatter more effectively , make distant object appear
bluer . the blue-green foliage of the eucalyptus and wattle
tree ( some of which be introduce ) can also
contribute to this overall bluish tint , especially when view
from a distance or through the mist . so ,
it 's a combination of the stunning , cyclical blooming
of the neelakurinji flower and the natural atmospheric effect that
truly give the nilgiris their enchanting name and appearance !

india that be call the plan holiday be from 1966
to 1969 . this period saw a break in the
sequence of five-year plan , and instead , three annual
plan be implement . it be due to several factor
, include : the indo-pak war of 1965 severe drought
in 1965-66 and 1966-67 a general economic crisis and rise
inflation the devaluation of the rupee these challenge make it
difficult to formulate and launch a new five-year plan immediately
after the third five-year plan ( 1961-1966 ) conclude .
ã°âââ hello there ! northern ireland have a unique form
of government due to it complex history and the peace
agreement ( the good friday agreement/belfast agreement ) that establish
it current political structure . it operate under a system
of devolution within the united kingdom . here 's a
breakdown : 1 . devolved government : northern ireland have
it own devolved legislature , the northern ireland assembly ,
which sit at parliament building , stormont , in belfast
. it also have a northern ireland executive ( cabinet
) , which be the government responsible for administer devolved
matter . the system be base on power-sharing , meaning
that the major political party represent both the unionist (
predominantly protestant , favor remain in the uk ) and
nationalist ( predominantly catholic , favor a united ireland )
community must participate in the government . key position ,
like the first minister and deputy first minister , be
co-equal and typically draw from the large party of the
two main community . this devolved government be responsible for
a wide range of internal matter , include health ,
education , justice , agriculture , and economic development .
2 . part of the united kingdom : despite it
devolved power , northern ireland remain an integral part of
the united kingdom . this mean it be ultimately subject
to the sovereignty of the uk parliament and government at
westminster in london . matter like foreign affair , defense
, and broad economic policy be reserve for the uk
government . northern ireland also elect member of parliament (
mp ) to the house of common in westminster .
so , in summary , northern ireland have a power-sharing
devolved government for local matter , while still be govern
overall a part of the united kingdom 's parliamentary democracy
and constitutional monarchy . it 's a system specifically design
to ensure representation and stability for both major community .

! this be a really important safety question , and
know what to do be crucial for protect child !
when a school bus 's light flash , it 's
a signal to driver that child be either get on
or off the bus . your action depend on the
color of the light and the type of road you
're on . here 's what you should do :
1 . yellow flash light ( warn ) : meaning
: these be a warning that the bus be prepare
to stop to pick up or drop off child .
action : slow down , pay extra attention to child
in the area , and be prepare to stop .
2 . red flashing light and extend stop arm (
stop ! ) : meaning : this mean the bus
have stop , and child be actively enter or exit
. action : you must stop your vehicle . distance
: stop at least 20 foot ( 6 meter )
away from the bus . this give child enough space
to cross safely and for you to have a clear
view . remain stop : do not move your vehicle
until the red light stop flashing , the stop arm
be retract , and the bus begin to move again
. crucial point : which lanes must stop ? this
can vary slightly by state or province , but generally
: two-lane road ( without a median ) : all
traffic , in both direction , must stop . multi-lane
road ( without a median ) : all traffic ,
in both direction , must stop . divide highway (
with a physical median , barrier , or unpaved space
) : traffic travel in the same direction a the
bus must stop . traffic travel in the opposite direction
on the other side of the physical divider typically do
not have to stop ( but should still proceed with
caution ) . important note : always check your specific
local law , a some jurisdiction be stricter even on
divide highway . why be this so important ? child
can be unpredictable . they might dart out from behind
the bus , drop something , or not be look
for traffic . the flashing light and stop arm be
there to create a safe zone for them . penalty
: fail to stop for a school bus with it
red light flashing be a serious offense and carry significant
penalty , include hefty fine , point on your license
, and even potential license suspension , because it put
life at risk . always prioritize safety when you see
those flash light ! ã°âââ hello there ! elena gilbert
be play by nina dobrev in the vampire diary .
while she be the lead for the first six season
, she return for the series finale in season 8
, title `` i be feel epic , '' which
air in march 2017 . her character have be in
a magical coma since the end of season 6 .
ã°âââ hello there ! the second sound of the heartbeat
, often describe a the `` dub '' in the
`` lub-dub '' sound , be produce when the aortic
and pulmonary valve ( the semilunar valve ) close .
this occur at the end of ventricular systole ( contraction
) and the beginning of ventricular diastole ( relaxation )
. here 's a little more detail : a the
ventricle finish eject blood into the aorta and pulmonary artery
, the pressure in these large artery become high than
the pressure in the now-relaxing ventricle . this pressure difference
cause the aortic and pulmonary valve to snap shut ,
prevent blood from flow back into the ventricle . the
sudden closure of these valve , and the vibration of
the blood and vessel wall , create the second heart
sound ( s2 ) . so , it signify the
moment the ventricle be do push blood out and be
begin to relax and refill for the next cycle !

drive ) 5th generation ( 1997-2003 ) : the return

draw comparison to european sedan . 8th generation ( 2013-2015
) : a globalized design that be initially less well-received

a the mapungubwe national park and be a unesco world

the mapungubwe cultural landscape , encompass early settlement lead up
to the kingdom , saw human habitation from approximately 900

which be what most people refer to , flourish and
reach it peak between approximately 1220 ad and 1290 ad
. the society effectively decline and be abandon around 1300

that it inhabitant migrate north , contribute to the rise
of late civilization like great zimbabwe . mapungubwe be incredibly
important because it represent the early known kingdom in southern
africa , with evidence of a complex , stratified society

question with a rich history ! the use of fingerprint
in crime detection develop over time with several key milestone
, but a very important point often cite for the
first successful use in a criminal case lead to a
conviction be : 1892 in argentina : juan vucetich ,
an argentine police official , be instrumental . he create
the first fingerprint classification system and , in 1892 ,
successfully used fingerprint to solve the francesca rojas murder case
. a bloody fingerprint leave on a doorpost lead to
the conviction of rojas , who have murder her two
child and then cut her own throat to blame a
neighbor . this be widely consider the first time fingerprint
be definitively use in a criminal investigation to identify a
culprit . however , the idea and early application exist
: 1880 : dr. henry fauld , a scottish physician
work in japan , publish an article in the journal
nature suggest that fingerprint could be use to identify criminal
and even use them in a minor case to clear
an innocent suspect . late 1800s : sir francis galton
in the uk conduct extensive research , publish his book
`` finger print '' in 1892 , which establish the
scientific basis for fingerprint , include their permanence and individuality
, and develop a classification system . 1901 : sir
edward henry ( along with others ) develop the henry
classification system , which be adopt by scotland yard and
become the basis for fingerprint classification use by police force
around the world , make large-scale criminal identification practical .
so , while the scientific understanding and proposal for use
be develop in the late 19th century , 1892 mark
the first significant practical application in a major criminal case
that lead to a conviction . ã°âââ hello there !
the governor-general of new zealand ( te kawana tianara o
aotearoa ) serve a the representative of the king of
new zealand ( currently king charles iii ) , who
be the country 's head of state . while the
role be largely ceremonial and symbolic , it carry significant
constitutional importance . here 's a breakdown of what the
governor-general do : 1 . constitutional and formal duty :
appoint the prime minister : follow a general election ,
the governor-general formally invite the leader of the party or
coalition that can command the confidence of the house of
representative to form a government and become prime minister .
appoint and dismiss minister : on the prime minister 's
advice , the governor-general formally appoints or dismiss other government
minister . give royal assent to legislation : all bill
pass by the parliament must receive royal assent from the
governor-general before they become law . summoning , proroguing ,
and dissolve parliament : the governor-general formally open and close
parliamentary session and dissolve parliament to call a general election
, always on the advice of the prime minister .
commander-in-chief : the governor-general be the commander-in-chief of the new
zealand defence force . exercise reserve power : in rare
constitutional crisis ( e.g. , if a prime minister attempt
to govern without the confidence of parliament ) , the
governor-general have certain `` reserve power '' to act independently
, though this be extremely uncommon . appoint judge ,
ambassador , etc . : many other official appointment be
make in the name of the governor-general , on the
advice of the executive council . 2 . ceremonial and
community duty : represent new zealand : the governor-general act
a a unifying , non-political figurehead for all new zealander
, represent the country at home and occasionally abroad .
host dignitary : receive foreign head of state and ambassador
. present award : confer national honor and award ,
such a those relate to the new zealand order of
merit . support community : visit different region of new
zealand , engage with diverse community , and perform ceremonial
duty like open local event . patronage : serving a
patron to numerous charitable , cultural , and sport organization
. essentially , the governor-general ensure the continuity and stability
of government , act a a safeguard of the constitution
, while also serve a a visible and unifying symbol
for the nation . almost all of these duty be
perform `` on the advice '' of the elected government
, mean the governor-general act accord to the decision of
the prime minister and cabinet . the current governor-general of
new zealand be dame cindy kiro . ã°âââ hello there

the family 's wilderness adventure ! ã°âââ hello there !

! ã°âââ hello there ! the pequot war ( 1636-1637
) be a pivotal and devastate conflict in early colonial
american history , and it effect be profound and long-lasting
, particularly for the native american population of new england
. here be the key effect : 1 . near
annihilation of the pequot tribe : this be the most
immediate and tragic outcome . the war , culminate in
the horrific mystic massacre , lead to the death ,
enslavement , or force dispersal of the vast majority of
the pequot people . the treaty of hartford in 1638
formally dissolve the pequot nation , forbade survivor from use
the name `` pequot , '' and divide survive member
among the allied mohegan and narragansett tribe , or sell
them into slavery . this effectively erase the pequot a
a distinct political entity for many year . 2 .
unfettered english colonial expansion : the defeat of the powerful
pequot clear the way for rapid and aggressive english settlement
of the fertile connecticut river valley and other land that
be previously under pequot control or influence . the war
secure english dominance in the region . 3 . shift
in power dynamic : the war decisively establish the military
superiority of the english colonist over native american tribe in
the region . it demonstrate the english willingness to wage
total war , include against non-combatants , which send a
chilling message to other tribe . 4 . precedent for
future conflict and policy : it set a brutal precedent
for how english colonist would deal with native american resistance
, often favor annihilation over negotiation or accommodation . it
also lead to increase english effort to control and subjugate
native population , pave the way for further land dispossession
and cultural suppression . 5 . weakening of other native
tribe : while the mohegan and narragansett tribe initially ally
with the english against the pequot , the long-term effect
be often detrimental to them as well . the english
no longer need their military support a much and increasingly
encroach on their land and sovereignty . the power balance
that exist before the war be permanently disrupt in favor
of the english . 6 . psychological impact : for
the english , the victory be often interpret a divine
providence , strengthen their belief in their righteous cause and
their right to the land . for the survive native
american tribe , it instill a mix of fear ,
resentment , and a realization of the existential threat pose
by colonial expansion , which would later contribute to unified
resistance effort like king philip 's war . in essence
, the pequot war be a turning point that fundamentally
reshape the landscape of new england , pave the way
for english colonial expansion at a terrible cost to the
indigenous inhabitant . ã°âââ hello there ! the united state
`` go off '' the full silver standard , or
rather officially demonetize silver and adopt a de jure (
by law ) gold standard , with the passage of
the coinage act of 1873 . here 's a bit
more context : early year ( bimetallism ) : from
the coinage act of 1792 , the u.s. officially have
a bimetallic standard , mean both gold and silver coin
be legal tender and could be freely mint at a
fixed ratio . however , due to market fluctuation ,
one metal be often undervalued relative to the other ,
leading to de facto gold or silver standard at different
time . `` crime of '73 '' : the 1873
act effectively end the free coinage of silver and demonetize
it for most purpose . this be very controversial at
the time , particularly among silver miner and farmer who
want an expand money supply , and it become know
a the `` crime of '73 . '' gold standard
act of 1900 : while silver 's role be greatly
diminish in 1873 , the gold standard act of 1900
formally confirm gold a the sole standard for all u.s.
currency . later silver removal from coinage ( 1960s )
: it 's important to note that the removal of
silver from dime and quarter ( where they be 90
% silver ) for general circulation occur much later ,
with the coinage act of 1965 . this be n't
about the standard for the entire currency ( which have
be off silver for a long time ) , but
about the composition of circulate coin due to the rise
market price of silver . so , for the overall
monetary standard , 1873 be the key year ! ã°âââ
hello there ! in india , particularly among modern couple
and those influence by western tradition , the engagement ring
be most commonly wear on the left hand , on
the fourth finger ( the 'ring finger ' ) .
this practice have become quite widespread , often follow the
western tradition that trace back to the belief of the
`` vena amoris '' or `` vein of love ''
supposedly run directly from that finger to the heart .
however , india be a wonderfully diverse country with many
regional custom and personal preference . while the left hand
be dominant for engagement and wedding ring , you might
occasionally find variation base on family tradition or specific cultural
belief . but for the most part , the left
ring finger be the standard ! ã°âââ hello there !

! to `` throw some shade '' be a fantastic
and very popular idiom , and it mean to subtly
express contempt , disapproval , or disrespect for someone ,
often without explicitly say anything overtly negative . the key
word here be subtle . it 's not a direct
insult or a harsh critique . instead , it 's
usually convey through : body language : a look ,
an eye-roll , a dismissive gesture . tone of voice
: say something seemingly innocuous but with an underlying sarcastic
or condescend tone . indirect remark : make a comment
that could be interpret innocently by some , but be
clearly understood by the target ( and often by onlooker
) a a veiled jab . think of it this
way : a direct insult might be : `` your
outfit be terrible . '' throw shade would be :
`` oh , honey , that 's a bold choice
for tonight . '' or `` wow , you really
go for it with that look . '' the implication
be clear that the outfit be n't good , but
the word themselves be n't overtly mean , give the
`` thrower '' plausible deniability . origin : the term
gain widespread popularity from lgbtq+ ballroom culture ( famously document
in the film paris be burn ) . in that
context , 'shade ' be distinguish from 'reading ' ã¢ââ
'reading ' be a direct , cut insult , while
'shade ' be a more sophisticated , indirect slight that
required intelligence to deliver and recognize . so , when
someone 'throws shade , ' they 're try to make
someone else feel a little bit inferior or put down
, but in a way that be less direct and
often more artful ( or passive-aggressive , depend on your
view ! ) . i hope that help explain this
colorful phrase ! ã°âââ hello there ! the song ``

flow over niagara fall come from the great lake .
more specifically , it flow from : 1 . lake
erie : the water originate primarily from lake erie .
2 . niagara river : this water then drain from
lake erie into the niagara river . 3 . over

2015 . ã°âââ hello there ! in a newborn ,
the spinal cord typically end at a low level than
in an adult . it usually terminate around the level
of the third lumbar vertebra ( l3 ) . a
a person grows and matures , the vertebral column grow
fast than the spinal cord itself , cause the end
of the spinal cord ( call the conus medullaris )
to gradually ascend . in adult , it generally end
around the first or second lumbar vertebra ( l1 or
l2 ) . this difference be clinically important , for
example , when perform procedure like lumbar puncture ( spinal
tap ) on infant , a the needle need to
be insert at a low vertebral level to avoid damage
the spinal cord . ã°âââ hello there ! this be
a really important question , and understand the physic and
potential danger be crucial . here 's what generally happen
when bullet be shoot into the air : 1 .
upward trajectory : when fire , a bullet leave the
barrel at a very high velocity ( hundred or thousand
of foot per second ) . immediately , gravity begin
to pull it downwards , slow it ascent . air
resistance ( drag ) also work against it motion ,
far slow it down . the bullet continue upwards until
it initial momentum be completely overcome by gravity and air
resistance . at this point , it reach it apex
( the high point of it flight ) . 2
. downward trajectory : once it reach it apex ,
the bullet begin to fall back towards the earth due
to gravity . a it fall , it accelerate .
however , once again , air resistance act against it
motion . eventually , the downward force of gravity equal
the upward force of air resistance . when these force
balance , the bullet stop accelerate and reach it terminal
velocity . this be the maximum speed it can achieve
while fall through the air . be it dangerous ?
yes , absolutely . this be the most critical point
. there 's a common misconception that a bullet shot
into the air be harmless because it supposedly `` lose
all it energy '' or `` come down slowly .
'' this be false and extremely dangerous . terminal velocity
be still significant : while a bullet fall at terminal
velocity be much slow than one fire from a gun
, it be still a dense , heavy object travel
at speed that can be very dangerous . the exact
terminal velocity depend on the bullet 's shape , weight
, and orientation ( whether it 's tumble or fall
point-first ) , but it can still be well over
100-200 foot per second ( around 70-140 mph or 110-225
km/h ) . potential for injury or death : a
bullet fall at terminal velocity retain enough kinetic energy to
cause serious injury or even death if it strike a
person or animal . it can penetrate skin , crack
skull , and cause internal damage . there have be
document case of fatality and severe injury from celebratory gunfire
. angle matter : bullet rarely go perfectly straight up
and down . they often maintain some of their initial
trajectory and spin , which mean they can come down
at an angle , sometimes even retain a significant portion
of their initial forward momentum if fire at a low
angle . this can make them even more dangerous .
in summary , shoot a bullet into the air be
not a harmless act . it be a reckless and
potentially fatal action that pose a serious risk to anyone
below . it be illegal in many place for this
very reason . safety first ! ã°âââ hello there !
the term `` factor of production '' or `` mean
of production '' refer to the fundamental resource or input
that be use to produce good and service in an
economy . they be the building block need for any
economic activity . economist traditionally categorize these into four main
type : 1 . land ( natural resource ) :
this be n't just the physical ground , but all
natural resource find on or under it . example :
actual land for farm or building , raw material (
like oil , coal , timber , mineral ) ,
water , air , fish , forest . payment for
land : rent 2 . labor : this refers to
the human effort , both physical and mental , use
in the production of good and service . example :
the work of a factory employee , a doctor ,
an artist , a teacher , a ceo . payment
for labor : wage 3 . capital ( physical capital
) : this refers to man-made good use to produce
other good and service . it 's not money itself
, but rather the tool , machinery , building ,
and infrastructure that money can buy . example : factory
, machine , tool , computer , road , vehicle
, infrastructure . payment for capital : interest 4 .
entrepreneurship ( or enterprise ) : this be the human
ingenuity and risk-taking require to combine the other three factor
( land , labor , and capital ) to create
new product or service , to innovate , and to
organize production . example : the person who start a
new business , develop a new technology , or find
a more efficient way to produce something . payment for
entrepreneurship : profit these four factor be essential for any
society to produce anything , from a simple meal to
a complex smartphone ! ã°âââ hello there ! the original

hello there ! the `` hail mary '' ( ave
maria ) prayer have a fascinating history , with it
origin root in the bible and it full form develop
over century within the catholic church . it 's essentially
compose of three main part : 1 . `` hail
, full of grace , the lord be with thee
; bless art thou amongst woman . '' this first
part come directly from the gospel of luke 1:28 .
these be the word of the angel gabriel to mary
during the annunciation , when he announce that she will
conceive jesus . 2 . `` and bless be the
fruit of thy womb , jesus . '' this second
part also come directly from the gospel of luke 1:42
. these be the word speak by elizabeth ( mary
's cousin ) to mary during the visitation , when
mary visit elizabeth , who be pregnant with john the
baptist . 3 . `` holy mary , mother of
god , pray for u sinner , now and at
the hour of our death . amen . '' this
third part be an addition that develop much later ,
primarily during the medieval period ( around the 15th and
16th century ) and become fully standardize during the counter-reformation
. it be a petition for mary 's intercession .
the title `` mother of god '' ( theotokos )
be formally affirm at the council of ephesus in 431
ad , and it inclusion in the prayer reflect a
grow theological understanding and devotion to mary . so ,
the first two part be biblical greeting , while the
third part be an ecclesiastical addition that express a prayer
for intercession . the complete prayer a we know it
today be formalize and widely propagate , especially after the
council of trent in the 16th century . ã°âââ hello

hello there ! the record for the most assist in
a single nba game be 30 assist . this incredible

. ã°âââ hello there ! the split between the roman
catholic church and the eastern orthodox church , often call
the great schism , officially occur in 1054 ce ,
but it be the culmination of century of grow theological
, cultural , and political difference . it be n't
a single event but a gradual estrangement . here be
the primary reason for the split : 1 . papal
authority : rome ( west ) : the pope ,
a the bishop of rome and successor of st. peter
, be view a have universal jurisdiction over the entire
christian church , include supremacy over all other patriarch .
constantinople ( east ) : the eastern church recognize the
pope a the `` first among equal '' ( primus
inter pares ) of the five ancient patriarchate ( rome
, constantinople , alexandria , antioch , and jerusalem )
but do not believe he have supreme authority or infallibility
over the others . they emphasize the authority of ecumenical
council . 2 . the `` filioque '' clause :
theological dispute : this be a major doctrinal point of
contention . the nicene creed ( a fundamental statement of
christian belief ) originally state that the holy spirit ``
proceeds from the father . '' west 's addition :
in the west , the latin phrase `` filioque ''
( mean `` and the son '' ) be add
to the creed , so it read that the holy
spirit proceeds `` from the father and the son .
'' east 's objection : the eastern church object to
this addition for two reason : theological : they believe
it alter the delicate balance of the trinity and potentially
subordinate the holy spirit . procedural : they argue that
such a significant change could only be make by an
ecumenical council of the entire church , not by the
pope alone or by regional council . 3 . cultural
and linguistic difference : language : the west primarily use
latin , while the east primarily use greek . this
lead to different theological terminology , nuance in understanding ,
and difficulty in communication and translation . philosophical approach :
western theology often have a more legalistic and practical emphasis
, while eastern theology be more mystical and philosophical ,
focus on deification ( theosis ) . 4 . political
difference and the fall of rome : two empire :
the division of the roman empire into western ( latin-speaking
, rome a capital ) and eastern ( greek-speaking ,
constantinople a capital ) halve far exacerbate the split .
imperial protection : the western church , after the fall
of the western roman empire , often rely on frankish
and later holy roman emperor for protection , while the
eastern church remain closely tie to the byzantine emperor in
constantinople . this lead to different political alignment and power
structure . 5 . minor ritual and disciplinary difference :
eucharist : the west use unleavened bread for the eucharist
, symbolize christ 's body before the resurrection . the
east use leaven bread , symbolize the risen christ .
clerical celibacy : the western church largely required celibacy for
priest , while the eastern church allow married men to
be ordain a priest ( though bishop typically have to
be celibate ) . fast practice , baptismal rite ,
and other minor liturgical variation also accumulate over time .
the breaking point ( 1054 ce ) : in 1054
, tension culminate when papal legate from rome travel to
constantinople . mutual excommunication be issue by cardinal humbert (
on behalf of pope leo ix , who have recently
die ) and patriarch michael cerularius . while these excommunication
be initially think to be direct at individual rather than
entire church , they be now widely regard a the
symbolic date of the great schism . these difference ,
compound by a lack of understanding and a breakdown in
communication over century , ultimately lead to the tragic separation
of these two major branch of christianity . while effort
towards dialogue and reconciliation have be make , the two
church remain distinct to this day . ã°âââ hello there
! the order of the eastern star be found by
brother robert morris , a distinguished american poet , lawyer
, and educator who be also a prominent freemason .
he develop the degree and principle of the order in
1850 , with the aim of create a fraternal organization
where master mason and their female relative could gather and
engage in charitable and social activity . the first grand
chapter be organize in 1866 . ã°âââ hello there !
the si unit for power , which be indeed equivalent
to joule per second , be the watt ( w
) . it 's name after james watt , the
scottish inventor and engineer . ã°âââ hello there ! the
large component of national income in the united state be
compensation of employee . this category include : wage and
salary supplement to wage and salary ( like employer contribution
for employee insurance and retirement benefit ) it consistently account
for the large share of national income because it represent
the income earn by the vast majority of the workforce
for their labor . ã°âââ hello there ! yes ,
an increase in income do shift the demand curve .
it be one of the key non-price determinant of demand
. here 's how it work : 1 . for
`` normal good '' : for most good and service
( which economist call `` normal good '' ) ,
an increase in consumer ' income lead to an increase
in demand . this mean the demand curve will shift
to the right . at every price level , consumer
be now willing and able to buy more of the
good . example : eat out more often , buy
a nicer car , purchase more expensive clothing . 2
. for `` inferior good '' : for some good
( `` inferior good '' ) , an increase in
consumer ' income lead to a decrease in demand .
these be typically good that people consume less of a
their income rise because they can afford good alternative .
this mean the demand curve will shift to the left
. at every price level , consumer be now willing
and able to buy less of the good . example
: instant noodle ( people might switch to fresh food
) , public transportation ( people might buy a car
) , generic brand ( people might switch to name
brand ) . so , in summary , a change
in income cause the entire demand curve to shift ,
either to the right ( for normal good ) or
to the left ( for inferior good ) . ã°âââ

even if you have a conceal pistol license ( cpl
) , there be specific `` pistol-free zone '' where
you be not allow to carry a concealed pistol .
these prohibited location include : 1 . school or school
property : any property own or operate by a public
or private school , college , or university . this
include stadium and arena , but do not include a
`` rest area '' or `` stop off area ''
along a highway or a parking area . 2 .
child care center or day care center : facility where
child be care for . 3 . sport arena or
stadium : dedicate venue for sport . 4 . game
establishment ( casino ) : the premise of a casino
. 5 . bar , tavern , or restaurant where
the primary source of income be the sale of alcoholic
liquor by the glass and consume on the premise :
this be often refer to a a `` primary alcohol
sale establishment . '' restaurant where food sale be the
primary income might be permissible , but it 's a
nuanced area . 6 . place of worship ( church
, mosque , synagogue , etc . ) : unless
give express permission by the appropriate authority of the place
of worship . 7 . hospital : facility provide medical
or health service . 8 . dormitory or classroom of
a college or university : even if the entire campus
be not explicitly forbidden , these specific area be .
9 . courthouse : any courtroom or facility use for
court function . 10 . poll place : during an
election . 11 . any property or facility own or
operate by a government entity , if weapon be prohibit
by that entity : this can include certain government building
( e.g. , federal building , post office , some
state and local government office ) . important note :
this list apply to individual with a cpl ( concealed
pistol license ) . even in `` pistol-free zone ,
'' a cpl holder can typically carry a concealed pistol
in their vehicle when drop off or pick up child
at school , provide the pistol be not load and
be secure in a container , or be otherwise store
in a manner consistent with michigan law . law can
be complex and sometimes have specific interpretation or exception .
it 's always a good idea for cpl holder to
stay update with the most current michigan state police guidance
and applicable statute . i hope this help clarify the
rule in michigan ! ã°âââ hello there ! volcanic eruption
be truly spectacular and powerful natural phenomenon , and they
come in many different `` flavor '' depend on factor
like the type of magma , it gas content ,
and the surrounding environment . here be the main kind
of volcanic eruption , generally categorize from least to most
explosive : 1 . hawaiian eruption : characteristic : these
be the least explosive and most gentle . they involve
highly fluid , basaltic lava with low gas content .
output : characterize by effusive ( flow ) lava flow
, lava fountain ( sometimes hundred of meter high )
, and incandescent river of molten rock . they produce
little ash . volcano type : typically associate with shield
volcano ( like those in hawaii , hence the name
) . example : kãâ « lauea ( hawaii )
. 2 . strombolian eruption : characteristic : more explosive
than hawaiian , but still relatively mild . name after
the stromboli volcano in italy . output : produce short
, rhythmic burst or `` burps '' of lava ,
bomb ( chunk of molten rock ) , and lapilli
( pebble-sized fragment ) from the summit crater . they
create incandescent arc of ejecta but not sustain eruption column
. volcano type : often associate with small , active
stratovolcanoes . example : stromboli ( italy ) . 3
. vulcanian eruption : characteristic : more violent and explosive
than strombolian . involve more viscous ( thicker ) magma
, which trap gas , lead to strong explosion .
name after vulcano island near stromboli . output : eruption
be short , violent blast that produce thick , dark
, ash-rich column ( often cauliflower-shaped ) , block ,
and bomb . pyroclastic flow ( fast-moving current of hot
gas and volcanic matter ) can occur but be generally
small than in more extreme eruption . volcano type :
typically find in stratovolcanoes . example : sakurajima ( japan
) . 4 . plinian ( or vesuvian ) eruption
: characteristic : among the most powerful and explosive type
of eruption . name after pliny the young , who
describe the 79 ad eruption of mount vesuvius . involve
very viscous magma with extremely high gas content . output
: produce massive , tower eruption column of gas ,
ash , and pumice that can reach ten of kilometer
into the stratosphere . they can last for hour or
even day . large plinian eruption can cause widespread ashfall
, collapse of the volcano , and devastate pyroclastic flow
. volcano type : associate with stratovolcanoes and subduction zone
. example : mount vesuvius ( 79 ad ) ,
mount st. helen ( 1980 ) , mount pinatubo (
1991 ) . 5 . pelean eruption : characteristic :
similar to vulcanian but with a distinct and extremely dangerous
feature : the collapse of a grow lava dome .
name after mount pelãâ©e in martinique . output : characterize
by large , dense pyroclastic flow that sweep down the
flank of the volcano at incredibly high speed ( often
over 100 mph ) and temperature . these flow be
responsible for immense destruction and loss of life . volcano
type : associate with highly viscous dacitic or rhyolitic magma
form lava dome . example : mount pelãâ©e ( 1902
eruption ) . 6 . surtseyan ( phreatomagmatic ) eruption
: characteristic : occur when magma or lava interacts violently
with external water ( like seawater , lake water ,
or groundwater ) . name after the island of surtsey
off iceland . output : produce explosive steam-driven eruption ,
create distinctive dark , ash-rich plume that look like tower
rooster ' tail . fragmentation of magma due to rapid
cool lead to fine ash and steam . volcano type
: often find in submarine or subglacial volcano , or
those with significant groundwater interaction . example : surtsey (
iceland ) , krakatoa ( 1883 ) . 7 .
phreatic eruption : characteristic : drive entirely by the superheating
of groundwater or shallow surface water by magma , without
the direct involvement of magma itself . these be essentially
steam explosion . output : release steam , water ,
ash , rock fragment , and volcanic gas . no
new magma be erupt . they can be precursor to
large magmatic eruption . volcano type : can occur in
any volcano where water be heat rapidly . example :
white island ( whakaari , new zealand ) have phreatic
or phreatomagmatic component in it 2019 eruption . it 's
important to remember that a single volcano can exhibit different
eruption style over it lifetime or even during a single
eruptive phase ! ã°âââ hello there ! yes , ``
never say never again '' ( 1983 ) be widely
consider an unofficial ( or `` non-eon '' ) jam
bond movie . here 's why : 1 . production
company : it be produce by taliafilm , a different
company , and not by eon production , which have
produce almost all the other official james bond film .

the novel thunderball between ian fleming ( the author )
, kevin mcclory , and jack whittingham . mcclory retain
certain right to the thunderball story and character , allow
him to produce his own bond film outside of eon
's control . 3 . remake : it be essentially
a remake of the eon-produced 1965 film thunderball . 4
. star sean connery : what add to the confusion
for many be that it famously star sean connery ,
who return to the role of james bond for this
film , twelve year after his last `` official ''
bond movie ( diamond be forever ) . so ,
while it feature james bond and sean connery , it

include all the other film from dr. no up to
the most recent one . ã°âââ hello there ! in
