question , but `` the western region '' be quite
broad , a the climate can vary dramatically depend on
which western region you 're refer to ( e.g. ,
western united state , western europe , western australia ,
west africa , etc. ) . however , if you
're think of the western united state , which be
a common interpretation , here 's a general overview of
it diverse climate : the western united state ( from
the rocky mountain to the pacific ocean ) have an
incredibly varied climate due to it vast size , vary
topography ( mountain , desert , coastline ) , and
proximity to the pacific ocean . here be the main
climate type you 'd find : 1 . mediterranean climate
( california coast ) : characteristic : warm , dry
summer and mild , wet winter . famous for it
sunshine and moderate temperature . san francisco be an example
, often with characteristic summer fog . location : coastal
california . 2 . semi-arid and arid ( desert )
climates ( southwest and great basin ) : characteristic :
very hot summer , significant diurnal temperature swing ( hot
day , cool night ) , and very low precipitation
year-round . some area can experience cold winter . location
: part of california ( e.g. , death valley )
, nevada , arizona , utah , new mexico ,
and part of idaho/oregon . 3 . alpine and highland
climate ( rocky mountain , sierra nevada , cascade )
: characteristic : cold winter with heavy snowfall , cool
summer . temperature decrease significantly with altitude . location :
high elevation in colorado , wyoming , montana , idaho
, california , oregon , and washington . 4 .
temperate rainforest/oceanic climate ( pacific northwest coast ) : characteristic
: mild , wet winter , and relatively cool ,
drier ( but still often cloudy ) summer . heavy
rainfall , especially along the coast . location : coastal
washington , oregon , and part of northern california .
5 . continental climate ( interior west ) : characteristic
: great temperature extreme than coastal area , with hot
summer and very cold winter . precipitation can vary .
location : inland area of montana , idaho , wyoming
, and part of colorado . so , a you
can see , the `` western region '' of the
u.s. be a mosaic of different climate ! to give
you a more precise answer , could you tell me
which `` western region '' you 're think of ?
ã°âââ hello there ! the los angeles charger play their
home game at sofi stadium in inglewood , california .
they share the stadium with the los angeles ram !
ã°âââ hello there ! the roman empire 's split into
eastern and western half be a long and complex process
, not a single event , drive by a combination
of administrative , geographical , cultural , economic , and
political factor . while it be formally divide by emperor
theodosius i in 395 ce , the seed of division
have be sown much earlier . here be the key
reason : 1 . sheer size and difficulty of administration
: by the 3rd century ce , the roman empire
be enormous , stretch from britain to the middle east
. it become increasingly difficult for a single emperor or
central government to effectively manage such a vast territory ,
particularly with slow communication and constant threat on multiple frontier
. 2 . administrative reform and the tetrarchy ( diocletian
, 284-305 ce ) : emperor diocletian recognize the administrative
challenge and formally divide the empire into two half for
administrative purpose , each with it own augustus ( senior
emperor ) and caesar ( junior emperor ) , create
the `` tetrarchy '' ( rule of four ) .
while this be mean to be a temporary solution for
efficient governance and defense , it solidify the idea of
a divided empire . 3 . shift of capital to
the east ( constantine , 330 ce ) : emperor
constantine move the imperial capital from rome to a new
city he build on the site of byzantium , rename
it constantinople ( modern-day istanbul ) in 330 ce .
this move create a powerful new center of gravity in
the east , which be wealthy , more urbanized ,
and strategically locate at the crossroad of major trade route
and close to the empire 's most persistent eastern enemy
. it effectively signal a permanent shift in power and
focus . 4 . cultural and linguistic difference : west
: predominantly latin-speaking , with a strong emphasis on roman
law , military prowess , and agriculture . east :
predominantly greek-speaking , with a more hellenistic culture , strong
intellectual tradition , and a more developed urban economy .
this linguistic and cultural divide make unified governance and communication
more challenging . 5 . economic disparity : the east
be generally wealthy . it have more developed city ,
good trade route ( connect to asia and africa )
, a large tax base , and be less expose
to devastate barbarian invasion . the west be more rural
, poorer , and increasingly rely on a shrink agricultural
base . it city be decline , and it face
significant economic instability . 6 . external pressure and barbarian
invasion : the western empire bore the brunt of the
most intense and sustained barbarian invasion from germanic tribe (
goth , vandal , frank , hun , etc .
) start in the late 4th century . these invasion
ravage it province , deplete it resource , and constantly
threaten it border . the eastern empire , while not
immune to invasion , have more defensible border , great
wealth to pay off invader , and a strong army
, often divert barbarian threat westward . 7 . political
instability in the west : the western empire experience frequent
change of emperor , often due to military coup or
short reign , lead to political fragmentation and a lack
of consistent leadership . the army , often compose of
barbarian mercenary , increasingly held power . the final split
( theodosius i , 395 ce ) : emperor theodosius
i be the last emperor to rule both the eastern
and western half of the roman empire . upon his
death in 395 ce , he formally divide the empire
between his two son : honorius receive the western roman
empire . arcadius receive the eastern roman empire . this
division , unlike diocletian 's , become permanent . the
western roman empire eventually collapse in 476 ce , traditionally
mark the end of ancient rome . the eastern roman
empire , know to historian a the byzantine empire ,
continue to flourish for another thousand year , preserve roman
and greek culture until it fall to the ottoman turks
in 1453 . ã°âââ hello there ! the movie title

hello there ! one of the most important and foundational

the long neuron in the human body can be well
over 3 foot ( around 1 meter ) long !
these incredibly long neuron be primarily find in the leg
, run from the low spinal cord all the way
down to the toe . specifically : motor neuron :
their cell body be in the lumbar region of the
spinal cord , and their axon extend down through the
leg ( a part of the sciatic nerve ) to
innervate muscle in the foot or toe . sensory neuron
: their peripheral process ( the long part of their
axon ) extend from sensory receptor in the toe or
foot , up through the leg to their cell body
locate in the dorsal root ganglion near the lumbar spinal
cord . so , essentially , they travel the entire
length of your leg ! be n't that amaze how
a single cell can stretch that far ? ã°âââ hello
there ! the five interlocking ring of the olympic symbol
be incredibly meaningful and carry a powerful message ! here
's a breakdown of their symbolism : 1 . number
of ring ( five ) : each ring represent one
of the five inhabited continent of the world : africa
the america ( north and south be combine ) asia
europe oceania ( australia and it surround island ) 2
. interconnectedness/interlocking design : the way the ring be link
together symbolize the unity and come together of athlete from
all over the world to compete in the olympic game
. it represent the universal and global nature of the
olympic movement . 3 . color ( blue , yellow
, black , green , red on a white field
) : the creator of the symbol , pierre de
coubertin ( founder of the modern olympic game ) ,
state that the color be choose because at least one
of these five color ( plus the white background )
appear on every national flag in the world at the
time ( 1913 ) when the symbol be design .
this further emphasize the universal participation and inclusion of all
nation . so , in essence , the olympic ring
stand for the come together of the five continent ,
unite by the spirit of the olympic game , with
color that represent all the nation of the world .
it 's a beautiful and endure symbol of global peace
and athletic competition ! ã°âââ hello there ! the most

be one of the most common and widespread igneous rock
find on earth , particularly within continental crust . because
it form from magma cool slowly deep underground , it
's typically expose where significant erosion have occur , or
where mountain-building event have uplift deep crustal material . you
can find granite in numerous location around the world ,
often in large formation . here be some of the
key place and type of geological setting : 1 .
mountain range : many major mountain range have granite a
a core component , a it form during the tectonic
collision that create mountain . north america : sierra nevada
( california , usa ) , appalachian mountain ( eastern
usa ) , rocky mountain ( western usa ) ,
canadian shield . south america : andes mountain ( though
less common than some other igneous rock , granite do
occur ) , brazilian shield . europe : alp ,
scandinavia ( norway , sweden , finland - part of
the baltic shield ) , scottish highland . asia :
himalaya ( india , nepal , china ) , ural
mountain ( russia ) . 2 . continental shield and
craton : these be very old , stable part of
continental crust , often form the `` basement '' rock
. canadian shield ( north america ) baltic shield (
scandinavia , europe ) african craton ( e.g. , in
south africa , west africa ) brazilian shield ( south
america ) australian shield ( e.g. , yilgarn craton in
western australia ) indian peninsular shield 3 . batholith and
pluton : these be large , intrusive igneous rock body
that have cool and solidify beneath the earth 's surface
. when erosion remove the overlie rock , these vast
granite mass be expose . many mountain range be underlain
by granite batholith . 4 . desert and arid region
: erosion process in desert can expose massive granite outcrop
, often create strike landscape . for example , part
of the sahara desert and australian outback feature significant granite
. in essence , wherever you find ancient , stable
continental landmass or area that have experience past mountain-building ,
you be very likely to find granite ! it 's
a rock that speak to the deep , long history
of our planet 's geology . ã°âââ hello there !
that 's a great question , a sap erp system
be a very common term in the business world !
let 's break down each part : 1 . sap
: sap stand for system , application & product in
data processing . it 's the name of a german
multinational software corporation , found in 1972 . sap be
the world 's leading provider of enterprise software for manage
business operation and customer relation . 2 . erp :
erp stand for enterprise resource planning . it 's a
type of software system that organization use to manage day-to-day
business activity such a accounting , procurement , project management
, risk management , compliance , and supply chain operation
. the core idea of erp be to integrate all
facet of an operation into a single , comprehensive information
system , enable real-time data flow and communication across different
department . this help a company improve efficiency , decision-making
, and consistency . # # # what be an
`` sap erp system '' ? when people refer to
an `` sap erp system , '' they be talk
about sap 's specific software solution design for enterprise resource
planning . in essence , it 's a suite of
integrated software module that enable a company to manage and
automate it core business process across various department . key
characteristic and what it help company do : integration :
it bring together data from different function ( e.g. ,
finance , human resource , manufacturing , supply chain ,
sale , customer service ) into a single database .
this eliminate data silo and improve data accuracy . automation
: automate many routine task , reduce manual effort and
error . real-time data : provide real-time insight into business
operation , allow for faster and good decision-making . standardization
: often help to standardize business process across an organization
. module : an sap erp system be typically comprise
of various module , such a : financial accounting (
fi ) controlling ( co ) sale and distribution (
sd ) material management ( mm ) production planning (
pp ) human capital management ( hcm ) / human
resource ( hr ) and many more . historically ,
the flagship sap erp product be know a sap ecc
( erp central component ) . more recently , sap
have introduce it next-generation erp platform , sap s/4hana ,
which leverage in-memory computing and be design for the digital
age . so , an sap erp system be a
powerful , integrated software solution from the company sap that
help business large and small run their entire operation more
efficiently and effectively ! ã°âââ hello there ! the impressive

constitutional monarchy . let 's break that down : federal
: this be a crucial aspect of belgium 's government
. it mean that power be divide between a central
federal government and several sub-state entity ( region and linguistic
community ) . this structure be adopt to manage the
linguistic and cultural difference between it dutch-speaking ( flemish )
and french-speaking ( walloon ) population , and the small
german-speaking community . parliamentary : the executive branch ( the
government , lead by the prime minister ) be accountable
to the legislative branch ( the parliament ) . the
head of government ( prime minister ) be typically the
leader of the party or coalition that can command a
majority in parliament . constitutional monarchy : the country have
a monarch ( currently king philippe ) who serve a
the head of state . however , the monarch 's
power be largely ceremonial and symbolic , define and limit
by the constitution . actual political power rest with the
elected government and parliament . so , in essence ,
belgium be a country where a king be the symbolic
head , but real governance be conduct by a democratically
elect parliament and government , with significant power devolve to
regional and community level . ã°âââ hello there ! chris

about a very symbolic flag ! the german flag consist
of three horizontal stripe of black , red , and
gold ( often visually appear a yellow , but ``
gold '' be the historically and officially preferred term )
. the color represent the following : black : symbolize
the darkness of servitude or oppression of the past .
red : represent the bloody struggle for freedom and unity
. gold : signify the golden light of liberty and
a brighter future for the german nation . these color
have a deep historical root , primarily emerge during the
war of liberation against napoleon in the early 19th century
. they be famously adopt by the lãâ¼tzow free corp
, a volunteer unit of student and academic who wear
black uniform with red trim and gold ( brass )
button . this combination become a symbol of liberal and
nationalist aspiration for a unified , democratic germany . the
black , red , and gold color be first officially
adopt by the weimar republic ( 1919-1933 ) and then
again by the federal republic of germany ( west germany
) in 1949 , and later by the reunify germany
. they stand a a powerful symbol of democratic value
and national unity . ã°âââ hello there ! the u.s.

great question , particularly common in real estate , construction
, and project management ! hard cost and soft cost
refer to different category of expense within a project ,
primarily distinguish between the physical building/creation and the non-physical ,
administrative , and design aspect . here 's a breakdown
: # # # hard cost what they be :
these be the direct , tangible expense associate with the
physical construction , acquisition , or creation of an asset
or project . they be often what you can literally
`` see and touch '' in the final product .
example : building material : concrete , steel , lumber
, glass , roofing , wiring , pipe , drywall
, fixture . direct labor : wage for construction worker
, electrician , plumber , carpenter , mason , etc.
, who be physically build the structure . heavy equipment
: rental or purchase of machinery like excavator , crane
, bulldozer . site work : land clearing , grading
, excavation , foundation pouring . landscaping : the cost
of the plant , soil , and installation of the
physical landscape ( though design fee for landscape would be
soft ) . hvac , plumbing , electrical system :
the actual component and installation . in simple term :
if you knock down a building , you 're primarily
remove the hard cost . # # # soft cost
what they be : these be the indirect , often
intangible expense that be essential for the planning , design
, management , legal , and administrative aspect of a
project . they occur before , during , and sometimes
after the physical construction , but they be not directly
tie to the material or labor of the physical build
itself . example : architectural fee : for design ,
blueprint , specification . engineering fee : structural , mechanical
, electrical , civil engineering . permit and licensing fee
: building permit , zone approval , environmental permit .
legal fee : for contract , land acquisition , compliance
, dispute . insurance : builder 's risk insurance ,
general liability , property insurance during construction . project management
fee : for oversee the entire project , scheduling ,
coordination . financing cost : loan interest , appraisal fee
, loan origination fee . survey fee : land survey
. tax : property tax during the construction period .
marketing and sale cost : for a real estate development
. temporary facility : construction trailer , portable toilet ,
temporary utility ( sometimes debate , but often categorize a
soft ) . contingency : fund set aside for unforeseen
expense , often cover both hard and soft cost overrun
. in simple term : soft cost be the ``
paperwork , brainwork , and overhead '' that make the
physical construction possible and compliant . # # # key
difference summarize : tangibility : hard cost be for physical
, tangible asset . soft cost be for service and
administrative function . visibility : hard cost be visible in
the finished product . soft cost be not directly visible
. timing : hard cost be concentrate during the construction
phase . soft cost be spread throughout the project lifecycle
( pre-construction , during , and post-construction ) . understand
the distinction be crucial for accurate budgeting , project financing
, and risk management in many industry ! ã°âââ hello
there ! the document that establish the combatant command 's
mission and area of responsibility ( aors ) in the
united state military be the unified command plan ( ucp
) . here 's what that mean : purpose :
the ucp be a classified document sign by the president
of the united state , typically upon the recommendation of
the secretary of defense and the chairman of the joint
chief of staff . content : it set forth the
mission , responsibility , and geographical ( aor ) or
functional boundary for all of the combatant command ( like
centcom , eucom , indopacom , northcom , socom ,
etc. ) . it also assign force and specifies general
guidance for their operation . frequency : it 's review
and update periodically , usually every two year , to
adapt to change geopolitical landscape and national security requirement .
significance : it ensure a clear chain of command and
control , delineate responsibility to avoid overlap or gap ,
and provide the strategic framework for how the u.s. military
organizes , train , and employ it force globally .
so , the ucp be the foundational document for understand
the structure and role of the u.s. combatant command !

. a of recent data , there be typically around
130 to 135 elementary school within the orange county public

new construction or consolidation ! ã°âââ hello there ! the

historic conference take place from april 25 to june 26
, 1945 . delegate from 50 nation meet there to
draft and formally sign the united nation charter , which
be the foundational treaty of the un and lay out
all the rule , purpose , and structure of the
organization , include the criterion for membership . while preliminary
groundwork for the un 's structure be do at the
dumbarton oaks conference in 1944 , it be at san
francisco that the definitive term of membership and the full
charter be adopt . ã°âââ hello there ! gabbie hanna

the building of the transcontinental railroad for a variety of
powerful and interconnected reason , reflect the major national priority
and ambition of the united state in the mid-19th century
. it be see a crucial for the nation 's
future . here be the key motivation : 1 .
national unity and manifest destiny : the idea of connect
the east and west coast be a cornerstone of manifest
destiny ã¢ââ the belief that the united state be destine
to expand across the north american continent . the railroad
would physically bind the vast country together , symbolize and
solidify national unity . after the civil war ( which
end shortly before the railroad 's completion ) , it
be particularly important for heal division and reaffirm a sense
of a single , unified nation . 2 . economic
growth and development : access to resource : the west
be rich in natural resource ( mineral , timber ,
agricultural land ) that could now be efficiently transport to
eastern market and port . new market : eastern manufacture
good could be ship to the grow western population ,
create new market . trade with asia : it would
open up new trade route with asia via pacific port
, boost international commerce . settlement : it encourage massive
westward migration and settlement , a it make travel easy
and more affordable , lead to the development of new
town and industry along it route . 3 . fast
and safe transportation & communication : before the railroad ,
travel across the continent be an arduous , dangerous ,
and time-consuming journey of several month by wagon train or
ship . the railroad reduce this to a matter of
day or week . it facilitate the speedy transport of
people , good , and importantly , mail and telegraph
communication ( telegraph line often run alongside the railway )
. 4 . military and strategic importance : the railroad
would allow for the rapid deployment of troop and supply
to secure territory , particularly in conflict with native american
tribe , and to enforce federal authority across the vast
western land . it be see a a vital national
defense asset . 5 . california 's importance : with
the california gold rush of 1849 , california become a
wealthy and strategically important state . there be a strong
desire to connect this valuable asset more securely to the
rest of the union , especially give it distance and
isolation . to achieve this monumental task , congress pass
the pacific railroad act ( most notably in 1862 and
1864 ) . these act provide significant financial incentive ,
primarily in the form of massive land grant and government
bond , to the company ( union pacific and central
pacific ) task with build the railroad . the land
grant allow the company to sell off parcel of land
along the track to help finance construction , while also
spur settlement . in essence , congress view the transcontinental
railroad not just a a transportation project , but a
a critical nation-building endeavor that would unlock the economic potential
of the west , secure national interest , and physically
embody the country 's aspiration . ã°âââ hello there !

exact `` first '' planting of potato in north america
can be a little nuanced depend on how you define
`` north america '' ( continental vs. include island )
and `` plant . '' however , the early and
most commonly cite instance be : 1 . bermuda (
an english colony , but an island territory ) :
potato be be cultivate there as early a 1613 ,
have be introduce from europe . 2 . virginia (
on the north american mainland ) : potato be likely
introduce to the english colony in virginia around 1621 ,
possibly bring from bermuda . it 's important to distinguish
these early introduction from the later , more widespread commercial
cultivation . for example , a significant and well-documented introduction
for widespread cultivation on the mainland happen much later ,
around 1719 , when scotch-irish immigrant bring potato to londonderry
, new hampshire . but for the very first planting
, it date back to the early 17th century .
so , either bermuda or virginia be often credit for
the early presence ! ã°âââ hello there ! the steinbrenner

hello there ! that 's a really insightful question ,
a the `` seven church '' in the book of
revelation ( chapter 2 and 3 ) carry multiple layer
of meaning and representation within christian theology . these be
seven actual christian community in roman asia minor ( modern-day
turkey ) during the 1st century ad . john ,
the author of revelation , record letter from jesus address
to each of these church : ephesus , smyrna ,
pergamum , thyatira , sardis , philadelphia , and laodicea
. here 's what they be generally understood to represent
: 1 . literal , historical church : at the
most direct level , they represent seven real church that
exist in john 's time , each face specific challenge
, strength , and weaknesses unique to their local context
. the letter contain genuine commendation , rebuke , warning
, and promise relevant to those particular congregation . 2
. seven era of church history ( prophetic interpretation )
: a common interpretation , especially in dispensational theology ,
be that each church represent a distinct period or era
in the entire history of the christian church , from
the apostolic age to the end time . for example
: ephesus might represent the early , zealous but possibly
lose it `` first love '' apostolic church . smyrna
the persecute church . pergamum the church that compromise with
the world . thyatira the medieval church with grow corruption
. sardis the `` dead '' church , perhaps represent
the need for the reformation . philadelphia the church of
great revival and missionary activity . laodicea the lukewarm ,
self-satisfied , materialistic church of the last day . in
this view , the letter be prophecy of how the
church would develop through history . 3 . universal archetype
for church and believer throughout time ( admonitory/universal interpretation )
: this be perhaps the most widely accept and applicable
interpretation . the seven church represent archetypal spiritual condition or
characteristic that can be find in any church or any
individual believer at any point in history . they serve
a timeless example and warning : a church can be
strong in some area but weak in others ( like
ephesus ) , persecute but faithful ( smyrna ) ,
compromise ( pergamum ) , doctrinally corrupt ( thyatira )
, spiritually dead ( sardis ) , faithful despite weakness
( philadelphia ) , or lukewarm and self-deceived ( laodicea
) . the message `` he who have an ear
, let him hear what the spirit say to the
church '' be a call to all christian to examine
themselves and their congregation against these standard . so ,
while they be real historical church , their inclusion in
the prophetic book of revelation give them a much broad
and endure symbolic significance , offer guidance , encouragement ,
and warning to all believer and church across all age
. ã°âââ hello there ! the punjab and haryana high
court have a fascinating history tie to the reorganization of
indian state ! it direct lineage in independent india can
be trace back to august 15 , 1947 , when
the high court of judicature for the province of punjab
( which be previously in lahore , now in pakistan
) be re-established a the high court of punjab for
the indian part of the divided province . it initially
function from shimla . however , it officially receive it
current name , the punjab and haryana high court ,
on november 1 , 1966 . this change occur when
the state of punjab be reorganize , and the new
state of haryana be form , along with the union
territory of chandigarh ( which serve a the common capital
for both state and the seat of the high court
) . so , while it root go back to
1947 , it current designation a the `` punjab and
haryana high court '' date to 1966 . ã°âââ hello

! the pharaoh of ancient egypt be incredibly wealthy ,
and their rich stem from a highly centralize and powerful
system that effectively give them control over the entire nation
's resource and labor . here be the primary source
of a pharaoh 's wealth : 1 . agricultural surplus
( the lifeline ) : land ownership : the pharaoh
effectively own all the land in egypt , particularly the
fertile nile river valley . tax in kind : farmer
pay a significant portion of their harvest ( especially grain
) a tax to the state . this grain be
store in royal granary and use to fee the populace
, soldier , priest , and worker on royal project
, or trade . control of the nile : the
annual flooding of the nile , which replenish the soil
, be manage through irrigation system , all under royal
authority , ensure agricultural productivity . 2 . natural resource
and mining : gold : egypt have extensive access to
gold , especially from the rich mine of nubia (
to the south ) . this be a massive source
of wealth , make egypt renowned throughout the ancient world
for it gold . copper and other metal : mine
in the sinai peninsula and other desert region provide copper
for tool and weapon . precious stone : quarry provide
stone like lapis lazuli , turquoise , amethyst , and
various decorative stone use for jewelry and royal adornment .
stone quarry : vast quarry of limestone , granite ,
and sandstone provide the material for the pharaoh ' monumental
building project ( pyramid , temple , tomb ) ,
all require immense organization and labor control by the crown
. 3 . labor ( corvãâ©e labor ) : the
pharaoh have the right to demand labor from his subject
for public work . this `` corvãâ©e labor '' (
a form of tax pay in labor ) be use
for building temple , pyramid , tomb , palace ,
irrigation system , and staff the army . this essentially
mean that the vast majority of the `` cost ''
of these massive project be absorb by the state 's
direct control over human capital , not necessarily through monetary
payment in the modern sense . 4 . trade and
commerce : the pharaoh often control or have a monopoly
over major trade route and lucrative good . export :
egyptian grain , papyrus , and fine linen be highly
value . import : through trade ( or sometimes tribute/conquest
) , egypt acquire timber ( especially cedar from lebanon
) , exotic animal , incense , ivory , and
other luxury good from neighbor land . 5 . tribute
and spoil of war : when egypt conquer or exerted
influence over neighboring territory ( like nubia , part of
the levant ) , these region be often compel to
send regular tribute ( payment in gold , raw material
, good , or even people ) to the pharaoh
. successful military campaign also bring back immense spoil of
war , include gold , precious object , livestock ,
and captive ( who could be use a slave or
laborer ) . 6 . religious authority : the pharaoh
be consider a divine be or a direct representative of
the god on earth . this divine status legitimize his
absolute authority and his control over all the resource and
people of egypt . the immense wealth and land hold
by the powerful temple be also ultimately under the pharaoh
's supreme authority . so , the pharaoh 's wealth
be n't just gold and jewel ; it be his
absolute control over a highly productive agricultural land , rich
mineral resource , a vast workforce , and the strategic
position of egypt in ancient trade and geopolitics . ã°âââ

in the united state , the requirement to pay tax
be establish by the u.s. constitution and specifically reinforce by
an amendment . the primary legal authority for the federal
government to collect income tax come from the sixteenth amendment
to the united state constitution . it state : >
`` the congress shall have power to lay and collect
tax on income , from whatever source derive , without
apportionment among the several state , and without regard to
any census or enumeration . '' this amendment be ratify
in 1913 , clarify and confirm congress 's power to
levy a direct income tax without it have to be
apportion among the state ( which have be a point
of contention with early income tax attempt ) . beyond
this constitutional basis , federal law ( like the internal
revenue code , enact by congress ) and regulation provide
the specific detail on who must pay , what be
tax , and how it 's collect . state and
local tax be establish by their respective state constitution ,
statute , and local ordinance . ã°âââ hello there !
the song `` look what you make me do ''

case that effectively , though temporarily , ban the use
of the death penalty be furman v. georgia , decide
in 1972 . in this landmark decision , the court
rule that the way the death penalty be be apply
at the time constitute `` cruel and unusual punishment ''
in violation of the eighth and fourteenth amendment . the
justice find that the death penalty be be impose in
an arbitrary , capricious , and discriminatory manner . this
ruling do n't declare the death penalty itself unconstitutional ,
but rather the procedure by which it be be hand
down . a a result , it lead to a
nationwide moratorium on execution and require state to rewrite their
capital punishment statute to ensure more consistent and less arbitrary
application . the death penalty be later reinstate in 1976
with the gregg v. georgia decision , after state have
revise their law to address the concern raise in furman
. ã°âââ hello there ! coleen carlton have a very

question , a both cocker spaniel and springer spaniel be
wonderful dog , but they do have distinct difference in
their appearance , temperament , and original purpose ! let
's break them down : # # # cocker spaniel
( american cocker vs. english cocker ) ( note :
there be two distinct breed , american cocker spaniel and
english cocker spaniel . the american be generally small and
more heavily coat , while the english be closer to
the springer in work build but still distinct . )
let 's focus on the more commonly know american cocker
spaniel for this comparison , a it represent the ``
cocker '' most people think of . key characteristic of
an american cocker spaniel : size & build : small
and more compact : typically 20-30 lb ( 9-14 kg
) and 13.5-15.5 inch ( 34-39 cm ) tall .
more finely bone , give a somewhat more `` dainty
'' or elegant appearance . appearance : coat : very
long , silky , and profuse feathering , especially on
the ear , chest , belly , and leg .
high grooming need . ear : very long , low-set
, and pendulous , heavily feather . muzzle : shorter
, broad , and more rounded muzzle . eye :
tend to be large , rounder , and soft in
expression . temperament : generally merry , gentle , affectionate
, and eager to please . can be sensitive and
sometimes prone to shyness if not well-socialized . good family
dog , but need consistent training . energy & exercise
: moderate energy level . require daily walk and playtime
, but not a intensely demand a a springer .
original purpose : breed primarily for flush and retrieve small
game ( like woodcock ) in dense cover , where
their small size be an advantage . # # #
english springer spaniel key characteristic of an english springer spaniel
: size & build : large and more athletic :
typically 40-55 lb ( 18-25 kg ) and 19-20 inch
( 48-51 cm ) tall . more robust and squarely
build , design for endurance and cover ground . appearance
: coat : a medium-length , denser coat , with
feather on the ear , leg , and belly ,
but generally less profuse and silky than an american cocker
. moderate grooming need . ear : also pendulous but
slightly short , set high , and less heavily feather
than a cocker 's . muzzle : long , more
refined , and square muzzle . eye : typically more
almond-shaped , intelligent , and keen in expression . temperament
: highly energetic , enthusiastic , intelligent , and eager
to please . know for be very friendly and active
. can be quite boisterous if not adequately exercised and
trained . excellent family dog for active household . energy
& exercise : high energy level . require a significant
amount of vigorous daily exercise , run , and mental
stimulation . they thrive on have a `` job ''
to do . original purpose : breed to `` spring
'' ( flush ) game bird ( like pheasant )
from cover so that they fly into the air for
hunter , and then retrieve them . their long leg
and athletic build help them cover more ground . #
# # in summary : the main distinguishing feature be
size ( springer be significantly large ) , coat length/profuseness
( cocker have much long , silky coat ) ,
muzzle length ( springer have long muzzle ) , and
energy level ( springer be typically far more energetic and
demand in term of exercise ) . both be intelligent
, affectionate , and loyal companion , but their specific
need and look reflect their different historical role a gun
dog ! ã°âââ hello there ! no , cristina yang

exit from the show , their romantic relationship be never
rekindle . ã°âââ hello there ! for the 2017 live-action

ã°âââ hello there ! that 's a fantastic question ,
but there 's no single answer because the number of
egg a fish produce each time ( know a it
fecundity ) vary enormously between different specie ! it can
range from just a few large egg to million of
tiny one , depend on factor like : specie :
different fish have different reproductive strategy . size of the
fish : large fish of the same specie generally produce
more egg . age of the fish : old fish
can often produce more egg . environmental condition : food
availability , water temperature , and other factor can influence
egg production . parental care : specie that provide extensive
parental care ( like some cichlid that mouthbrood ) tend
to produce few , large , and more developed egg
. specie that simply scatter their egg and offer no
care produce far more to increase the chance of survival
. here be some example to give you an idea
of the range : shark and ray ( some specie
) : can produce just a few large egg (
sometimes only one or two at a time ) ,
or even give live birth to fully form young .
some cichlid ( freshwater ) : might lay dozen to
a few hundred egg at a time , often guard
them carefully . salmon : a large female salmon might
lay 3,000 to 7,000 egg in a single spawning season
. cod : can lay several million egg ( e.g.
, 2-9 million in a single spawning event ) .
tuna : large tuna can produce ten of million of
egg per spawn season . so , it really depend
on what kind of fish you 're curious about !
ã°âââ hello there ! that 's a fantastic question about
a brilliant architectural innovation ! point arch ( a hallmark
of gothic architecture ) be remarkably efficient in how they
handle the weight of a structure compare to their round
, semicircular predecessor ( like those find in romanesque or
roman architecture ) . here 's what they do :
1 . direct weight more vertically downwards : unlike a
round arch , which tend to push it weight outwards
in a broad , horizontal thrust at it spring line
( where the arch meet the wall ) , a
pointed arch channel much more of that weight and force
more directly downwards . imagine the force a vector :
the steep angle of a point arch mean the vertical
component of the force be great , and the outward
horizontal thrust be significantly reduce . 2 . reduce outward
thrust : because the force be direct more vertically ,
the outward thrust on the support wall be greatly minimize
. this be a critical advantage . with less outward
thrust to counteract , the wall do n't need to
be a thick and massive a those require for round
arch . 3 . allow for great height and large
opening : since the wall be no longer burden by
immense outward pressure , they can be build much taller
and thinner . more importantly , this reduction in wall
mass allow for the insertion of much large window and
stained-glass panel , a defining feature of gothic cathedral ,
bring in more light . 4 . flexibility in span
and height : point arch be more versatile . they
can be build to different height and width ( different
radius ) while maintain a consistent height at the keystone
, which be crucial for vault complex architectural space like
those in a cathedral nave . this flexibility make it
easy to create complex vaulted ceiling . in essence :
pointed arch take the massive downward pressure from the roof
and upper wall and efficiently funnel it downwards rather than
outwards . this innovation , especially when combine with fly
buttress ( which specifically counteract any remain outward thrust by
transfer it to external support ) , allow for the
creation of incredibly tall , light-filled , and awe-inspiring structure
that seem to defy gravity . it be a revolutionary
leap in architectural engineering ! ã°âââ hello there ! the
first episode of phineas and ferb ( often refer to
a `` rollercoaster '' ) actually have a `` sneak
peek '' premiere on august 17 , 2007 . the
official series premiere , when it truly begin it regular
run , be on february 1 , 2008 . ã°âââ

ã°âââ hello there ! while the french revolution be a
complex event with many interconnected cause , the most significant
underlying cause be widely consider to be the deep-seated social
inequality and the inherent injustice of the ancien rãâ©gime (
old order ) . here 's why it stand out
: 1 . the three estate system : french society
be rigidly divide into three estate : first estate :
clergy ( about 0.5 % of the population , own
10-15 % of the land , largely exempt from tax
) . second estate : nobility ( about 1.5 %
of the population , own 20-25 % of the land
, hold most position of power , also largely exempt
from tax ) . third estate : everyone else (
about 97-98 % of the population , include peasant ,
urban worker , and the burgeon middle class or bourgeoisie
) . this vast majority bore almost the entire burden
of taxation , have little to no political power ,
and endure legal and social inequality . 2 . resentment
and injustice : the third estate deeply resent the privilege
and tax exemption enjoy by the first and second estate
. this create profound class antagonism and a pervasive sense
of injustice . the poor struggle for basic survival ,
the bourgeoisie seek political influence commensurate with their economic power
, and all be unite in their frustration with an
antiquated system . while this be the fundamental structural problem
, it be exacerbate and ignite by several other critical
factor : economic crisis : france be deeply in debt
from war ( especially the american revolution ) and extravagant
royal spending . poor harvest lead to food shortage ,
soar bread price , and widespread famine , particularly among
the urban poor . enlightenment idea : philosopher like rousseau
, voltaire , and montesquieu champion idea of liberty ,
equality , popular sovereignty , and natural right , which
provide the intellectual framework for challenge the absolute monarchy and
the exist social order . weak monarchy : king louis
xvi and queen marie antoinette be perceive a weak ,
indecisive , and out of touch with the suffering of
their people . influence of the american revolution : the
successful american struggle for independence inspire french revolutionary and demonstrate
that a revolution against an oppressive monarchy be possible .
so , while economic hardship and enlightenment ideal be powerful
catalyst , it be the fundamental unfairness and inequality embed
in the social structure of the ancien rãâ©gime that create
the fertile ground for revolutionary upheaval . ã°âââ hello there

kurtz . she bring a lot of humor to the
role ! ã°âââ hello there ! in the nba playoff
, the team with the good regular-season record get home
court advantage in each series . here 's a quick
breakdown : overall seeding : within each conference ( eastern
and western ) , team be seed 1 through 8
base on their regular-season win-loss record . series by series
: for any give playoff series , the team that
finish higher in the regular season standing ( i.e. ,
have the good overall record ) will have home court
advantage . this mean they will host game 1 ,
2 , 5 , and 7 ( if necessary )
in a best-of-seven series . so , for example ,
if the # 1 seed play the # 8 seed
, the # 1 seed have home court . if
the # 4 seed play the # 5 seed ,
the # 4 seed have home court . if a
# 6 seed from one conference make it to the
nba final against a # 1 seed from the other
conference , the # 1 seed would still have home
court advantage for the final because they would have have
the good overall regular-season record . ã°âââ hello there !
the beautiful song `` i do n't want to talk

phrase `` poison chalice '' come from a combination of
very old , literal practice and a strong metaphorical sense
, often with a subtle nod to historical and religious
context . literal origin : 1 . ancient practice :
the idea of a `` poisoned chalice '' ( or
cup ) literally come from ancient and medieval time ,
when assassination by poison be a grim reality , especially
for powerful figure like king , emperor , or rival
. poison would be secretly administer in a drink ,
often in a formal drinking vessel like a chalice (
a goblet-like cup , often associate with ceremony or royalty
) . it be a devious and effective way to
eliminate an enemy . evolution into an idiom ( metaphorical
meaning ) : 2 . the chalice : the use
of `` chalice '' rather than just `` cup ''
add a layer of formality , preciousness , or even
sacredness , make the betrayal or danger seem even more
insidious when it come from something that should be honorable
or desirable . 3 . modern usage : over time
, the literal act evolve into a metaphorical idiom .
a `` poison chalice '' now refer to a gift
, position , or opportunity that seem desirable at first
glance , but in reality , bring trouble , difficulty
, or ruin to the person who accept it .
it 's a responsibility or privilege that ultimately prove to
be a burden or a source of great misfortune .
connection ( often misunderstand ) : it 's sometimes mistakenly
link directly to the biblical `` cup of suffer ''
that jesus refers to ( e.g. , in gethsemane ,
`` let this cup pas from me '' ) .
while that metaphor also speak of impend doom or suffering
, it 's not the direct origin of the phrase
`` poison chalice '' a we use it today in
english . the idiom point more to a deceptive ,
harmful offer . so , it stem from the historical
reality of poisoned drink , become a powerful metaphor for
a seemingly good thing that lead to disaster ! ã°âââ
hello there ! the poinsettia be introduce to the united
state by joel robert poinsett . he be an american
botanist , physician , and the first united state minister
to mexico . he `` discover '' the plant in
mexico in 1828 and send sample back to the u.s
. the plant be then name `` poinsettia '' in
his honor ! ã°âââ hello there ! yes , there
be a very significant difference between state senator and u.s
. senator . they operate at completely different level of
government and have distinct role and responsibility . here 's
a breakdown : # # # u.s . senator (
federal level ) government level : federal ( national )
government . legislature : serf in the united state senate
, which be one of the two chamber of the
u.s. congress ( the legislative branch of the federal government
) . constituency : each u.s . senator represent an
entire state . there be two u.s . senator for
every state , regardless of population . ( so ,
100 u.s . senator total ) . term length :
6-year term . responsibility : creates and vote on federal
law that apply to the entire country . confirm presidential
appointment ( e.g. , cabinet member , federal judge ,
ambassador ) . ratifies treaty with foreign country . have
oversight over federal agency . deal with national and international
policy issue . location : primarily work in the u.s.
capitol building in washington , d.c. # # # state
senator ( state level ) government level : state government
. legislature : serf in the state legislature 's upper
chamber , which be also often call the `` state
senate '' ( though some state have different name )
. every state have it own bicameral ( two-chamber )
legislature , except nebraska , which be unicameral . constituency
: represent a specific senatorial district within their state .
the size and population of these district vary by state
. term length : varies by state , typically 2
or 4 year . responsibility : creates and vote on
state law that apply only within that particular state .
approve the state budget . deal with issue specific to
their state , such a education policy , state transportation
, state tax , and state regulation . may confirm
gubernatorial appointment ( e.g. , state cabinet member , state
judge ) . location : primarily work in the state
capitol building of their respective state . in essence ,
a u.s . senator deal with the `` big picture
'' national and international issue , while a state senator
focus on the law and policy that directly affect the
citizen and service within their specific state . both be
elect official , but their sphere of influence be distinct
. ã°âââ hello there ! in elie wiesel 's night

the decomposition of organic matter ( like plant and animal
) in anaerobic condition , mean in environment where there
be little to no oxygen . this process be carry
out by certain type of microorganism call methanogen . here
be some common source where this decomposition occur : wetland
and swamp : this be the large natural source ,
where waterlogged soil prevent oxygen from reach decay vegetation .
landfill : anaerobic decomposition of organic waste . digestive system
of ruminant animal : cow , sheep , goat ,
etc. , produce methane a a byproduct of their digestion
( fermentation ) . termite gut : similar to ruminant
, termite also produce methane . rice paddy : flood
rice field create anaerobic condition . ocean sediment : decomposition
in oxygen-poor seabed environment . so , in short ,
it 's the breakdown of once-living thing by microbe when
oxygen be n't available ! ã°âââ hello there ! the

ã°âââ hello there ! yes , it absolutely can snow
in the summer in alaska ! while the low elevation
and more southern part of alaska do experience warmer ,
often sunny summer day ( especially in june and july
) , snowfall be still quite common in certain area
: 1 . high elevation : in the mountain (
like the alaska range , chugach mountain , etc .
) , it can snow at any time of year
, even in the height of summer . the high
you go , the colder it get , and the
more likely you be to see snow . 2 .
far northern/arctic region : in the very northern part of
alaska , such a the arctic slope , summer be
brief and cool . while temperature can rise above freezing
, it 's not uncommon to get light snowfall ,
especially early or late in the summer season . so
, while you might be hike in a t-shirt in
anchorage , you could easily drive a few hour or
take a flight to a high or more northerly spot
and find fresh snow ! ã°âââ hello there ! ``
the power of now '' be a highly influential spiritual
book write by eckhart tolle , first publish in 1997
. at it core , the book be all about
the profound idea that true peace , joy , and
enlightenment can only be find by fully inhabit and be
consciously aware of the present moment . here 's a
breakdown of it main message : 1 . the tyranny
of the mind : tolle argue that most human suffer
stem from identify too strongly with our mind , which
constantly pull u into regret about the past or anxiety
about the future . this mental chatter and obsession with
`` what be '' or `` what will be ''
prevents u from experience life a it be actually happen
. 2 . the illusion of time : he suggest
that the past be just a memory and the future
be just an imagined thought ; neither truly exist outside
of the `` now . '' the only reality we
ever truly experience be the present moment . 3 .
the ego and the pain-body : tolle introduces concepts like
the `` ego , '' which be the mind-made sense
of self that thrive on time-bound thought and emotional drama
, and the `` pain-body , '' which be an
accumulation of old emotional pain that seek to perpetuate itself
by latch onto new suffering . both prevent u from
be present . 4 . the path to presence :
the book offer practical guidance and technique to help reader
escape this mental loop and become present . this involve
: observation : become the `` watcher '' of your
thought and emotion without judgment , rather than be consume
by them . non-resistance : accepting `` what be ''
in the present moment , rather than resist or fight
against it . feel the inner body : connecting with
the subtle energy and aliveness within your body a an
anchor to the present . surrender : letting go of
the need to control every outcome and trusting in the
flow of life . 5 . access `` be ''
: by become present , tolle suggest one can tap
into a deep sense of `` be '' ã¢ââ a
state of inner stillness , peace , and timelessness that
transcend the constant chatter of the mind and connect one
to a universal consciousness . ultimately , `` the power
of now '' be a powerful call to liberation from
the tyranny of the mind , urge reader to find
their true essence and a deep , more peaceful existence
in the eternal present . ã°âââ hello there ! huntersville

) ã°âââ end of chat the rise bowl get it
name from two main thing : 1 . the rise
parade ( tournament of rose parade ) : this be
the primary reason . the parade , which predate the
game by many year , begin in pasadena , california
, in 1890 . it purpose be to showcase california
's mild winter climate where flower be still bloom even
on new year 's day , unlike the harsh winter
in the rest of the country . float in the
parade be elaborately decorate with thousand of rose and other
natural flower . 2 . the `` bowl '' shape
of the stadium : the stadium itself , build in
1922 , be design in the popular `` bowl ''
shape common for large athletic arena of that era ,
similar to the yale bowl . here 's the chronological
breakdown : 1890 : the tournament of rose parade begin
in pasadena . 1902 : the first football game be
play a an added attraction after the parade . it
be initially call the `` tournament eastã¢ââwest football game .
'' early 1920s : a the game grow in popularity
, it need a permanent , large venue . construction
begin on a new stadium . 1922 : the new
stadium open . it be officially call the `` tournament
of rose stadium '' at first . however , due
to it distinctive `` bowl '' shape and it strong
association with the tournament of rose and it countless rose
, people quickly start call it the `` rise bowl
. '' the name stuck and become official . so
, it 's a combination of the iconic rose-themed parade
it accompany and the architectural shape of it home stadium
that give the rise bowl it famous name . it
's often call `` the granddaddy of them all ''
because it 's the old college football bowl game .
okay , imagine two super simple thing ! 1 .
the `` rise '' part : there 's a super
duper fun parade in a town , and guess what

`` rise bowl '' come from two simple but important
thing : 1 . the `` rise '' part :
this come from the tournament of rose parade . this
famous parade happen every single new year 's day in
pasadena , california , right before the football game .
the parade be famous for it elaborate float , which
be always cover in thousand of beautiful , fresh rose
and other flower . 2 . the `` bowl ''
part : this refers to the shape of the stadium
where the game be play . the stadium itself be
build in 1922 and design in a large , round
, sunken shape , much like a giant bowl .
this architectural style be popular for big stadium at the
time ( like the yale bowl , which predate it
) . so , you have the spectacular rise parade
, and the game be play in a bowl-shaped stadium
right after it . put them together , and you
get the rise bowl ! the civil liberty act of
1988 squarely place the blame for the internment of u.s.
citizen and permanent resident of japanese ancestry during world war
ii on : 1 . race prejudice : the act
explicitly state that the decision be `` motivate by racial
prejudice . '' 2 . war hysteria : the panic
and fear that grip the nation after the attack on
pearl harbor contribute to an atmosphere where extreme measure be
accept . 3 . a failure of political leadership :
the act point to the failure of president roosevelt ,
congress , and the supreme court to uphold the right
of these citizen . 4 . the absence of any
credible evidence of disloyalty : it highlight that there be
no factual basis to support the claim that japanese american
pose a threat to national security . in essence ,
the act repudiate the official justification give at the time
( national security necessity ) and conclude that the internment
be a `` grave injustice '' drive by racism and
fear , not by legitimate military necessity . it include
an official apology from the u.s. government and reparation for
the survivor . okay , imagine there be some kid
who be send to a special camp , even though
they have n't do anything naughty at all ! the
civil liberty act say this happen because : 1 .
some grown-ups be just be mean because of how those
kid look ( like someone be mean to you just
because you have different color hair ) . they do
n't like them just because they be from a japanese
family . 2 . other grown-ups get super , super
scar for no good reason ( like be scar of
a friendly little cat ) . they be scar of
thing that be n't actually go to happen . 3
. and the very important grown-ups who be suppose to
keep everyone safe and be fair , they do n't
do their job well . they should have say ,
`` no , this be wrong ! '' but they
do n't . so , the act say it be
wrong because people be mean , people be scar for
no real reason , and the grown-ups who be suppose
to help do n't stop it . the civil liberty
act of 1988 unequivocally place the blame for the internment
of u.s. citizen and legal permanent resident of japanese ancestry
during world war ii on specific factor , explicitly reject
the government 's original justification . the act state that
the fundamental cause be : 1 . race prejudice :
it identify `` racial prejudice '' a a primary motivating
factor . the internment be drive by negative stereotype and
discrimination against people of japanese descent , rather than by
evidence of disloyalty . 2 . war hysteria : the
intense fear and panic that sweep the nation after the
attack on pearl harbor create an atmosphere where extreme measure
be accept without proper scrutiny . 3 . a failure
of political leadership : the act fault the president (
franklin d. roosevelt ) , congress , and even the
supreme court for fail to uphold the constitutional right of
these individual . they do not adequately challenge or prevent
the unjust policy . 4 . the absence of any
credible evidence of disloyalty : crucially , the act underscore
that there be no factual basis or military necessity to
support the claim that japanese american pose a significant threat
to national security . in summary , the civil liberty
act repudiate the official government rationale of military necessity and
conclude that the internment be a `` grave injustice ''
cause by racism , fear , and a systemic failure
of government to protect it own citizen . the song
you 're think of be most likely `` woo hoo
'' by the 5.6.7.8 's . it become very famous
after be feature prominently in quentin tarantino 's movie kill

, be `` woo hoo '' by the japanese rock
band the 5.6.7.8 's . it gain widespread popularity after
be feature in quentin tarantino 's movie kill bill :
volume 1 . the anaerobic breakdown of glucose be generally
call fermentation . more specifically , there be two main
type of fermentation that follow the initial breakdown of glucose
( glycolysis ) : 1 . lactic acid fermentation :
this occur in animal muscle cell when oxygen be scarce
( e.g. , during intense exercise ) and in some
bacteria . glucose be break down into pyruvate through glycolysis
, and then pyruvate be convert into lactic acid .
2 . alcoholic fermentation : this occur in yeast and
some bacteria . glucose be break down into pyruvate through
glycolysis , and then pyruvate be convert into ethanol (
alcohol ) and carbon dioxide . both type of fermentation
allow glycolysis to continue by regenerate the nad+ need for
that process , but they produce far less atp (
energy ) than aerobic respiration . okay , imagine your
body ( or even tiny little helper in food ,
like yeast ! ) need energy to run and play
, right ? you get this energy from a kind
of sugar call glucose ( like super important food fuel
) . normally , your body use air ( oxygen
) to help it turn that food fuel into energy
. it 's like breathe while you eat your snack
. but sometimes , your body need energy really fast
and there 's not enough air to go around (
like when you run super , super fast ! )
. so , it have to find another way to
get energy from the food fuel without the air .
this special way of get energy from the food fuel
without any air be call fermentation ( say : fur-men-tay-shun
) . it 's like have a secret trick to
get energy when you ca n't breathe normally ! the
anaerobic breakdown of glucose be primarily call fermentation . more
specifically , there be two common type : lactic acid
fermentation : occurs in animal muscle cell and some bacteria
, produce lactic acid . alcoholic fermentation : occurs in
yeast and some bacteria , produce ethanol ( alcohol )
and carbon dioxide . both process follow glycolysis ( the
initial breakdown of glucose ) and occur in the absence
of oxygen . in geography , a meridian be an
imaginary half-circle line draw on the earth 's surface from
the north pole to the south pole . here 's
a breakdown of it key feature and purpose : 1
. shape and direction : meridian be always draw a
half-circles that run from true north to true south .
they be not full circle like line of latitude (
parallel ) . 2 . convergence at pole : all
meridian converge ( meet ) at the north pole and
the south pole . 3 . measurement of longitude :
meridian be the line use to measure longitude . longitude
tell you how far east or west a location be
from a start point . 4 . the prime meridian
: there be an infinite number of meridian , but
one be special : the prime meridian . it pass
through greenwich , london , england . it be designate
a 0 degree longitude . it serve a the reference
point from which all other longitude ( east or west
) be measure . the meridian directly opposite the prime
meridian , at 180 degree longitude , be largely the
international date line . 5 . perpendicular to parallel :
meridian always cross line of latitude ( parallel ) at
right angle . 6 . equal length : unlike parallel
( which get small a you go towards the pole
) , all meridian be the same length , a
they all stretch from pole to pole . in essence
: think of meridian a the vertical `` slice ''
on a globe that help u pinpoint exact east-west location
and be fundamental to understanding time zone . okay ,
imagine our earth be a giant , giant ball ,
like a big , round orange ! now , imagine
invisible line draw all over that orange , from the
very top ( that 's the north pole , where
santa live ! ) all the way down to the
very bottom ( that 's the south pole , where
penguin live ! ) . these invisible line , that
go straight up and down from the top of the
world to the bottom , be call meridian ( say
: muh-rid-ee-ans ) . they be like the line you
might see on an orange peel , go straight up
and down . why do we need them ? they
help grown-ups know exactly where thing be on our big
earth ball ! they help u figure out how far
'this way ' ( east ) or 'that way '
( west ) something be . there 's one super
special , most important line that be our start line
for counting . so , think of them a invisible
up-and-down stripe on our earth ball that help grown-ups find
place ! in geography , a meridian be an imaginary
half-circle line draw on the earth 's surface that extend
from the north pole to the south pole . here
be it key characteristic : direction : they run in
a true north-south direction . shape : each meridian form
half of a great circle that encircle the earth .
convergence : all meridian meet and converge at both the
north pole and the south pole . longitude : meridian
be the line use to measure longitude , which indicate
how far east or west a location be from a
reference point . prime meridian : the most famous meridian
be the prime meridian , which pass through greenwich ,
london , and be designate a 0 degree longitude .
all other longitude be measure a degree east or west
of the prime meridian . equal length : all meridian
have the same length because they all stretch from pole
to pole . essentially , meridian be the vertical line
on a globe or map that , along with parallel
( line of latitude ) , form a grid system
to precisely locate any point on earth . game of
throne largely get ahead of george r.r . martin 's

publish in 2011 , well before the show even finish

not yet be publish in book form . okay ,

season 7 finale . in human , the type of
fertilization that take place be internal fertilization . here 's
what that mean : 1 . internal : the fusion
of the male gamete ( sperm ) and the female
gamete ( egg ) occur inside the body of the
female . 2 . location : specifically , fertilization typically
happen in the fallopian tube ( also call the oviduct
) . 3 . process : during sexual intercourse ,
sperm be deposit into the female 's reproductive tract .
the sperm then travel up through the cervix and uterus
into the fallopian tube , where one sperm can fertilize
an egg that have be release from the ovary .
4 . outcome : the fertilized egg ( now call
a zygote ) then travel down to the uterus to
implant and develop . this be in contrast to external
fertilization , which occur outside the body , usually in
water ( common in fish and amphibian , where egg
and sperm be release into the environment ) . okay
, imagine when a mommy and a daddy want to
start make a tiny baby ! for human , it

that these two tiny thing meet and join together inside
the mommy 's body . it all happen safe and
warm inside her ! it 's not like fish ,
where they lay egg in the water , and the
daddy fish put his seed on them outside . nope
! for human , it 's all tuck away safely
inside . so , because it happen inside the mommy
, we call it internal fertilization ( say : in-tern-al
fur-til-eye-zay-shun ) . that just mean the baby-making start happen
on the inside ! in human , the type of
fertilization that take place be internal fertilization . this mean
that the fusion of the male gamete ( sperm )
and the female gamete ( egg ) occur inside the
female 's body . specifically , it typically happen in
the fallopian tube . essentially , there be no difference
between a gaussian distribution and a normal distribution . they
be two different name for the exact same probability distribution
. here 's why there be two name : normal
distribution : this name come about because many natural phenomenon
( like height of people , measurement error , test
score ) tend to cluster around a central value ,
make this distribution seem `` normal '' or common in
the real world . gaussian distribution : this name honor
the german mathematician carl friedrich gauss , who make significant
contribution to it study and application , particularly in the
context of error theory and the method of least square
in the early 19th century . key characteristic of this
distribution ( regardless of what you call it ) :
it be symmetrical and bell-shaped . it mean , median
, and mode be all equal and locate at the
center of the curve . it be entirely define by
two parameter : it mean ( average ) and it
standard deviation ( how spread out the data be )
. so , if you hear someone say `` gaussian
distribution '' or `` normal distribution , '' they be
talk about the exact same fundamental statistical concept . it
's like call a soft drink `` soda '' in
one place and `` pop '' in another ã¢ââ they
refer to the same thing . okay , this be
a super easy one ! there be no difference between
a gaussian distribution and a normal distribution ! it 's
like have two name for the exact same thing .
imagine you have a fluffy pet cat . you might
call it your `` cat , '' but sometimes you
also call it your `` kitty , '' right ?
it 's the same fluffy friend , just with two
different names ! normal distribution be like call it a
`` cat . '' it 's a common name because
lot of thing we count in the world naturally look
like this special shape . gaussian distribution be like call
it a `` kitty . '' it 's just another
name for the same thing , because a very smart
grown-up name mr. gauss ( say : gowss ) study
it a lot and help u understand it good .
and what be this `` cat '' or `` kitty
'' shape ? it 's like a gentle hill or
a pretty bell ! most thing we count , like
how tall all your friend be , or how many
cooky everyone eats , often make this kind of hill
shape when you line them up . so , they
be the same ! just two word for the same
math idea . there be no difference between a gaussian
distribution and a normal distribution . they be two different
name for the exact same probability distribution . normal distribution
be the more common , descriptive name , reflect that
many natural phenomenon follow this pattern . gaussian distribution be
name after carl friedrich gauss , the mathematician who significantly
contribute to it study . so , when you hear
either term , they refer to the identical bell-shaped ,
symmetrical probability curve characterize by it mean and standard deviation
. the first movie elvis presley make be love me

he be initially cast in a supporting role for what
be originally title the reno brother , a western .
however , due to his rapidly increase musical popularity (
especially after `` heartbreak hotel '' and his early tv
appearance that year ) , his role be expand ,
and several song be add for him to sing ,
include the famous title track `` love me tender .
'' the movie be then re-titled to capitalize on the
song 's immense success . okay , imagine a super
, super famous singer who love to wiggle his hip
and make everyone dance ! his name be elvis presley
. one day , he decide to try be in
a movie too ! his very first movie be call
