first big step from just sing song to also be
a movie star ! the first movie elvis presley make
be love me tender , release in 1956 . he
be originally cast in a supporting role for a western
film call the reno brother . however , due to
his explosive musical popularity that year , his role be
expand , and several song be add , include the
iconic `` love me tender . '' the movie 's
title be then change to capitalize on the song 's
massive success . the standard of living refers to the
level of material well-being and comfort experience by individual or
a population in a specific geographic area ( like a
country , region , or city ) . it essentially
measure the level of wealth , good , and service
available to people , and how accessible these be .
key factor and indicator commonly use to assess the standard
of live include : income : such a gdp per
caput , disposable income , median household income . employment
rate : the availability of job and economic stability .
access to quality good and service : like food ,
housing , transportation , communication , and consumer product .
healthcare : access to medical care , life expectancy ,
infant mortality rate . education : literacy rate , access
to school and high education . infrastructure : access to
clean water , sanitation , electricity , road . poverty
rate : the percentage of people live below the poverty
line . in essence , it answer the question :
how well do people live in term of their economic
resource and access to material comfort ? it 's important
to distinguish it from `` quality of life , ''
which be a broad concept that include non-material factor like
personal happiness , environmental quality , political freedom , social
relationship , and security , in addition to material well-being
. okay , imagine two friend . one friend have
: lot of yummy food to eat every day .
a warm , cozy bed to sleep in . lot
of fun toy to play with . can go to
the doctor when they 're sick . go to a
nice school to learn . the other friend might not
have all those thing easily . maybe they do n't
always have enough food , or their house be n't
a warm , or they do n't have many toy
. the `` standard of living '' be just a
grown-up way of say how much good stuff people have
and can get easily to make their life comfy ,
healthy , and happy ! it 's about have enough
food , a safe home , doctor , and fun
thing . the standard of living refers to the level
of material well-being and comfort that be available to people
in a particular geographic area ( such a a country
, region , or city ) . it be a
measure of the economic health and material prosperity of a
population , focus on the amount and accessibility of good
, service , and amenity that contribute to their daily
life . key factor and indicator commonly use to assess
the standard of live include : income and wealth :
gdp per caput , median household income , disposable income
. employment : employment rate , job security , wage
level . access to basic necessity : availability and quality
of food , housing , clean water , and sanitation
. healthcare : access to medical service , life expectancy
, infant mortality rate . education : literacy rate ,
access to school and high education opportunity . infrastructure :
quality of transportation , communication network , and utility (
electricity , internet ) . consumer good : access to
and affordability of various consumer product . poverty rate :
the percentage of the population living below the poverty line
. in essence , the standard of living quantifies how
well people be do financially and materially , reflect their
ability to acquire the good and service necessary for a
comfortable and healthy existence . it 's often contrast with
`` quality of life , '' which be a broad
concept that also include non-material factor like happiness , environmental
quality , political freedom , and social relationship . the
transition from preindustrial society to industrial society , famously know
a the industrial revolution , be bring about by a
complex interplay of several interconnected factor . no single cause
be solely responsible , but rather a perfect storm of
development converge to transform society , first in great britain
and then globally . the primary driver include : 1
. technological innovation and invention : this be arguably the
most direct and visible cause . new machine : invention
like the spin jenny , water frame , power loom
, and cotton gin revolutionize textile production , shift it
from home to factory . new power source : the
development and improvement of the steam engine ( by james
watt ) provide a powerful , versatile energy source that
could run machine anywhere , not just near river .
this lead to factory move to city and the widespread
use of coal . iron and steel production : innovation
in smelt and refine iron ( like the puddle process
) lead to strong , cheap material for machine ,
bridge , and building . 2 . the agricultural revolution
: prior development in farm be crucial precursor . new
farm technique : innovation like crop rotation , selective breeding
, and the enclosure movement ( privatize common land )
lead to significantly increase food production . increase food supply
: good nutrition lead to a healthy population and a
decline in death rate . surplus labor : few farmer
be need to produce food , lead to a large
pool of displaced rural worker who migrate to city ,
seek employment in the new factory . 3 . population
growth : fuel by the agricultural revolution 's increase food
supply and improve sanitation , population growth provide : a
large workforce for the burgeon factory . an expand consumer
market for the mass-produced good . 4 . access to
raw material and natural resource : coal : abundant coal
deposit in place like britain be essential for power steam
engine and fuel iron production . iron ore : necessary
for machinery and construction . waterway : river and canal
provide early transportation network and hydropower for initial factory .
colonial resource : access to raw material like cotton from
colony be vital for the textile industry . 5 .
economic condition and capital : capital for investment : merchant
and landowner accumulate wealth from trade ( include colonial trade
and the transatlantic slave trade ) and agriculture , provide
the capital necessary to invest in new factory , machine
, and infrastructure . banking and finance : developed financial
system , include bank and joint-stock company , facilitate investment
and risk-taking . expand market : grow domestic and international
market ( include colonial market ) create demand for good
, incentivizing mass production . 6 . political stability and
supportive government policy : stable government : in place like
britain , a relatively stable political system that protect private
property right and contract encourage entrepreneurship and long-term investment .
laissez-faire economics : a prevail philosophy of limited government intervention
in the economy allow business to operate with few regulation
. patent system : a system that protect inventor '
right encourage innovation . in summary , the transition be
not a singular event but a profound societal shift drive
by a combination of scientific discovery , technological innovation ,
change in agricultural practice , population dynamic , economic incentive
, and a supportive political and social environment . okay
, imagine a long , long , long time ago
, almost everything be make by hand ! if you
want a shirt , someone have to spin the thread
with their finger , then weave it , then sew
it ã¢ââ it take a super long time ! and
most people live on farm . then , thing start
to change , like magic ! this big change be
cause by a few cool thing : 1 . super-duper
new tool ! ( new invention ) smart grown-ups invent
amazing new machine ! like a machine that could spin
lot of thread at once , instead of just one
! and a machine that could weave cloth much faster
. the big helper be a machine that make steam
( like the puff from a kettle ! ) that
could make other machine work . it be super powerful
! 2 . more yummy food ! ( well farm
) farmer get really , really smart and learn new
trick to grow way more food than before ! like
plant different thing each year so the dirt stay healthy
. when there be more food , people be healthy
and live long , so there be more people !
3 . lot of help hand ! ( more people
for work ) because farmer be so good , not
everyone need to be a farmer anymore . so ,
lot of people move from their farm to big town
to work with the new machine in big building call
factory . 4 . money to build cool stuff !
( money & idea ) some grown-ups have extra money
and they use it to build big factory and buy
all the new machine . they have good idea to
make thing quick and sell them . so , it
be like a big puzzle where all the piece fit
together : new clever machine , new way to get
power for them ( like steam ! ) , lot
of food make more people , and people with money
and idea to build it all . this make society
change from everyone make thing slowly by hand on farm
, to make lot and lot of thing very fast
with machine in big city ! it be a huge
change ! the transition from preindustrial society to industrial society
, commonly know a the industrial revolution , be bring
about by a confluence of interconnected factor that begin primarily
in great britain in the late 18th century . the
main catalyst be : 1 . technological innovation : new
machine : invention like the spin jenny , water frame
, power loom , and cotton gin revolutionize textile production
, shift manufacturing from home to factory . new power
source : the development and widespread adoption of the steam
engine ( most notably by james watt ) provide a
reliable and versatile source of power , allow factory to
be build anywhere , not just near river , and
fuel advancement in transportation ( steamship , railway ) .
2 . the agricultural revolution : increase food production :
innovation in farm technique ( e.g. , crop rotation ,
selective breeding , new tool ) lead to a significant
increase in food supply . population growth : good nutrition
and hygiene result in a healthy population , low death
rate , and a large overall population . labor surplus
: few people be need to work on farm ,
create a large pool of available labor that migrate to
urban center seek work in the burgeon factory . 3
. abundance of natural resource : coal and iron :
country like britain possess vast reserve of coal ( essential
for steam power and iron smelting ) and iron ore
( crucial for build machine , tool , and infrastructure
) . 4 . economic factor and capital : capital
for investment : accumulate wealth from trade ( include colonial
trade and the transatlantic slave trade ) , agriculture ,
and early industry provide the necessary capital for entrepreneur to
invest in new factory , machinery , and infrastructure .
develop banking system : a stable financial system facilitate investment
and risk-taking . expand market : grow domestic and international
demand for good stimulate mass production . 5 . political
stability and supportive government policy : stable government : a
relatively stable political environment in britain , with strong property
right and contract law , encourage entrepreneurship and long-term investment
. laissez-faire economics : a prevailing economic philosophy of limited
government intervention allow business to operate with few regulation .
patent system : a system that protect inventor ' right
incentivized innovation . in essence , it be a complex
interplay of scientific advancement , technological breakthrough , change in
agricultural practice , demographic shift , economic incentive , and
a conducive political and social environment that collectively drive the
transition from a largely agrarian , craft-based society to an
industrial , factory-based one . you light a yahrzeit candle
for yom kippur before sundown on the eve of yom
kippur ( the evening of kol nidre ) . here
's why : 1 . observe the holiday : yom
kippur , like all jewish holiday , begin at sundown
. once the holiday officially start , certain activity ,
include light a new flame , be generally prohibit (
though one can transfer a flame from an exist one
for permitted us ) . to ensure the candle burn
throughout the entire day of yom kippur , it must
be light before the holiday commences . 2 . connection
to yizkor : yom kippur be one of four jewish
holiday during which the yizkor ( memorial ) prayer be
recite in synagogue . it be customary to light a
yahrzeit candle ( often refer to a a `` ner
neshama '' or soul candle ) in the home prior
to these holiday a an act of remembrance for all
decease love one , not just those whose yahrzeit fall
specifically on that day . 3 . duration : yahrzeit
candle be design to burn for approximately 24-26 hour ,
ensure they last for the entire duration of yom kippur
( which be also about 25 hour from sundown to
sundown ) . so , in summary , you light
the yahrzeit candle just before light your main yom kippur
holiday candle on the evening that yom kippur begin .

hug for their memory . you light this candle before
the sun go all the way down on the night
before yom kippur . it 's like put on a
nightlight before it get dark , so it can glow
all night and all through the next day , help
you remember your loved one for the whole special time

particularly a yom kippur be one of the holiday when
the yizkor ( memorial ) prayer be recite . in

get frustrate with lennie but deeply care for him .

: george milton be the small , sharp-witted , and
intelligent man . he 's the planner , the protector
, and the one who look out for lennie ,
often get frustrate with him but always remain loyal .
lennie small be the large , physically strong , but
mentally disabled man . he have the mind of a

which often lead to unintentional harm and trouble . he
be entirely dependent on george . so , to summarize

= the big , strong , childlike one . the
french phrase `` ãâcrasez l'infãâ¢me '' ( pronounce : eh-krah-zay
lahng-fahm ) translate most directly to `` crush the infamous
'' or `` crush the infamous thing . '' this
powerful rally cry be famously use by the enlightenment philosopher
voltaire ( franãâ§ois-marie arouet ) in the 18th century .
for voltaire , `` l'infãâ¢me '' ( the infamous thing
) represent religious fanaticism , superstition , intolerance , and
all form of oppression that stifle reason , freedom ,
and human progress . while often direct at the abuse
of the catholic church in france during his time ,
particularly it dogmatism , persecution , and censorship , it
be also a broad condemnation of any system , institution
, or belief that suppress human thought and promote cruelty
in the name of dogma . he frequently sign his
letter with this phrase , urge his fellow enlightenment thinker
to actively combat these force . it become a succinct
expression of the enlightenment 's core ideal of reason ,
tolerance , and liberty against the perceived darkness of superstition
and tyranny . okay , imagine there 's something really
, really mean and unfair , like a big bully
who tell everyone what to think and hurt people for
not agree . the grown-up word `` ãâcrasez l'infãâ¢me ''
( say : eh-krah-zay lahng-fahm ) be like say :
'' squash the big , mean bully ! '' or
`` get rid of the yucky , unfair thing !
'' a very smart man name voltaire use to say
this a long , long time ago . he mean
that people should fight against anything that be mean ,
unfair , or make people stop think for themselves ã¢ââ
especially old idea that be not nice and make people
scared . so , it 's about squash bad idea
and bad bully ! the french phrase `` ãâcrasez l'infãâ¢me
'' ( pronounce : eh-krah-zay lahng-fahm ) directly translate to
`` crush the infamous thing '' or `` crush the
infamous . '' this powerful motto be famously use by
the enlightenment philosopher voltaire ( franãâ§ois-marie arouet ) in the
18th century . for voltaire and his fellow enlightenment thinker
, `` l'infãâ¢me '' ( the infamous thing ) symbolize
: religious fanaticism and intolerance : especially the dogmatism ,
superstition , and persecution carry out by the establish church
of his time . tyranny and oppression : any form
of unjust authority , censorship , or intellectual suppression that
hinder freedom of thought and expression . ignorance and unreason
: the force that prevent humanity from advance through logic
, science , and open inquiry . it be a
call to actively combat these societal ill that voltaire believe
stifled progress , reason , and human liberty . he
frequently conclude his voluminous correspondence with this phrase , urge
his contemporary to challenge and dismantle these oppressive structure and
idea . yes , `` entourage '' be largely base
on mark wahlberg 's early experience in hollywood . while
it 's not a direct autobiography , the series draw
heavily from : wahlberg 's own entourage : he have
a close-knit group of childhood friend from boston who move
to hollywood with him and live off his success .
these friend serve a inspiration for character like johnny drama
( base partly on his cousin , johnny alves ,
and his brother , donnie wahlberg 's friend , johnny
`` banana '' alves ) and turtle ( base on
his real-life assistant/driver , donnie carroll , who later pursue
a rap career under the name `` big lou ''
) . his rise to fame : the show mirror
the trajectory of a young , working-class kid from boston
make it big in the entertainment industry . the specific
dynamic of hollywood : the show capture the often absurd
, indulgent , and sometimes cutthroat world of movie deal
, party , agent , and public relation that wahlberg
experienced first-hand . mark wahlberg himself serve a an executive

his real-life manager and produce partner stephen levinson , pitch

by wahlberg 's actual life and the people around him
during his early career . yes ! imagine a super

the united state gain control of texas after arm conflict
with the force of mexico . this conflict be primarily
the mexican-american war ( 1846-1848 ) . while texas have
already declare independence from mexico in 1836 ( form the
republic of texas ) , mexico still consider texas a
rebellious province and do not recognize it independence or it
annexation by the united state in 1845 . the dispute
over the southern border of texas be a major cause
of the mexican-american war . the war conclude with the
treaty of guadalupe hidalgo , in which mexico cede a
vast amount of territory ( include california , nevada ,
utah , arizona , and part of new mexico ,
colorado , and wyoming ) to the u.s. , and
formally recognize the u.s. annexation of texas with the rio
grande a it southern boundary . okay , imagine a

of kid ) really want texas . but another big
group of kid , mexico , also think texas belong
to them . so , they have a big fight
( a war ! ) over texas . after the
fight , the united state win , and then texas
become part of the united state . so , the
fight be with the force of mexico ! the united
state gain control of texas after arm conflict with the
force of mexico . this conflict be primarily the mexican-american
war ( 1846-1848 ) . while texas have already fight
for and declare it independence from mexico in 1836 (
become the republic of texas ) , mexico never formally
recognize texas 's independence or it late annexation by the
united state in 1845 . this unresolved territorial dispute ,
particularly over the southern border of texas , be a
major trigger for the mexican-american war . the war conclude
with the treaty of guadalupe hidalgo , in which mexico
officially recognize the u.s. annexation of texas and cede a
large amount of additional territory to the united state .

call pepperoncini ( especially in the u , where they
be typically find pickle ) be a specific type of
mild chili pepper , usually from the specie capsicum annuum
. more specifically , they be often cultivar like the
'golden greek ' pepper or other similar variety . here
be their key characteristic : mild heat : they be
know for be very mild , often rank between 100
and 500 on the scoville scale ( sometimes even 0
) , make them significantly less spicy than jalapeãâ±os .
appearance : they be typically small , thin-skinned , and
crinkly . color : when pick for pickle , they
be usually a yellow-green color . if leave to mature
on the plant , they can turn red . flavor
: they have a tangy , slightly sweet , and
mildly peppery flavor , especially after be pickle . important
note on terminology : while `` pepperoncini '' in american
english refers specifically to these mild , pickle pepper ,
in italian , `` pepperoncino '' ( singular ) be
a generic term for any small , hot chili pepper
. so , if you order `` pepperoncini '' in
italy , you might get something much spicy than what
you expect in the u ! okay , imagine there
's a big family of `` pepper '' ã¢ââ some
be super duper spicy and make your mouth feel like
fire ! but the pepper use for pepperoncini ( say
: pepp-er-awn-chee-nee ) be the super friendly , not-spicy kind
of pepper ! they be usually a pretty yellow-green color
, a little bit crinkly , and they live in
a jar full of yummy vinegar to make them tangy
and delicious . so , they be a special kind
of pepper that 's gentle and add a nice zesty
taste , not a super hot one ! the pepper
use for what we commonly call pepperoncini ( especially in
the u , where they be almost always find pickle
) be a specific type of mild chili pepper from
the specie capsicum annuum . more precisely , they be
often cultivar like the 'golden greek ' pepper or similar
variety grow for their mild heat and specific flavor .
key characteristic : heat level : they be very mild
, typically range from 100 to 500 scoville heat unit
( sometimes even 0 ) , make them much less
spicy than a jalapeãâ±o . appearance : they be usually
small , relatively thin-skinned , and have a somewhat crinkly
or wrinkled appearance . color : when pick for pickle
, they be typically a yellow-green color . if allow
to fully ripen on the plant , they can turn
red . flavor : they offer a tangy , slightly
sweet , and mildly peppery taste , which be enhance
by the pickling process . it 's worth note that
in italian , `` pepperoncino '' ( singular ) be
a generic term for any small , hot chili pepper
. however , in american english , `` pepperoncini ''
specifically refer to these mild , pickle yellow-green pepper .

akhtar specialize primarily in ghazal , dadra , and thumri
. she be a legendary indian classical singer , often

, and be celebrate for her unique and evocative rendition
of these form of vocal music . while she also
perform other semi-classical and light classical form , these three

of thing . you know how some people be really

be really , really good at draw superheroes ? they
have a special thing they be best at ! well

she be super good at : 1 . ghazals (

( say : thum-rees and dah-dras ) : these be
like sing playful or emotional story , often about love

to her profound mastery and emotionally resonant rendition of this
poetic song form . while she also explore other semi-classical

. discretion in the criminal justice system refers to the
power to make choice among alternative course of action .
it 's exercise at nearly every stage by various actor
, allow for flexibility and individualized justice within the bound
of the law . here be the primary actor who
have significant discretion : 1 . law enforcement ( police
officer ) : initial contact : decide whether to stop
, question , or observe a person . investigation :
determine how thoroughly to investigate a crime , which lead
to pursue . arrest : decide whether to make an
arrest , issue a warning , or give a citation
for a perceived offense . this be a critical point
where an officer choose to invoke the formal justice process
. use of force : decide the level of force
necessary in a give situation . reporting : how they
document event and evidence . 2 . prosecutor ( district
attorney , state 's attorney ) : charge decision :
one of the most powerful form of discretion . prosecutor
decide : whether to file charge at all . what
specific charge to file ( e.g. , felony vs. misdemeanor
, a less offense ) . the number of charge
. whether to pursue the death penalty . plea bargaining
: offering defendant a reduced charge or sentence in exchange
for a guilty plea . dismissal : deciding to drop
charge , even after they 've be file . sentence
recommendation : recommend a specific sentence to the judge .
3 . judge : pre-trial ruling : decide on bail
amount , motion ( e.g. , to suppress evidence ,
to dismiss charge ) , and schedule . trial ruling
: decide on the admissibility of evidence , jury instruction
, and handle courtroom conduct . sentencing : within statutory
guideline , judge often have considerable discretion in determine the
specific sentence for a convict offender ( e.g. , probation
, fine , length of incarceration , condition of release
) . appellate review : high court judge have discretion
in decide which case to hear and how to interpret
law . 4 . correctional official ( probation and parole
officer , prison administrator ) : probation officer : recommend
condition of probation , monitor compliance , and decide whether
to recommend revocation if condition be violate . parole board
: decide whether to grant parole to inmate ( allow
early release ) and set the condition for that release
. they also have discretion in revoke parole . prison
administrators/correctional officer : making decision about inmate placement , privilege
, disciplinary action , and daily management within correctional facility
. why be discretion necessary ? it allow the system
to : handle diverse situation : not every case fit
neatly into rigid rule . conserve resource : not every
minor offense need full prosecution . achieve individualized justice :
consider the unique circumstance of each offender and victim .
respond to public opinion : adapt to community standard and
priority . why be discretion controversial ? it can lead
to : bias and discrimination : if discretion be not
exercise fairly , it can perpetuate racial , socioeconomic ,
or other bias . inconsistency : similar case might be
treat differently . abuse of power : when unchecked ,
discretion can be misuse . in summary , discretion be
a fundamental and pervasive aspect of the criminal justice system
, wield by a variety of professional to make critical
decision that shape the outcome for individual and the overall
functioning of justice . okay , imagine the rule at
school , or the rule at home ! sometimes ,
a grown-up in charge ( like your teacher or your
mommy/daddy ) have to make choice . in the criminal
justice system ( that 's just a grown-up way to
say how we figure out if someone break a rule
and what happen next ) , lot of different grown-ups
get to make choice ! this power to make choice
be call discretion ( say : dis-kresh-un ) . here
be some of the grown-ups who get to choose :
1 . police officer ( the cop ) : imagine
if you run too fast in the hallway . a
police officer might see it . they get to choose
if they just tell you , `` walk , do
n't run ! '' ( a warning ) or if
they say , `` oops , you break a rule
, i need to tell the principal ! '' (
take you to the station ) . they choose how
big the problem be . 2 . the special lawyer
( call prosecutor ) : if someone get catch do
something wrong , there 's a special lawyer who decide
if we should have a big trial to figure it
out , or if maybe the person just need a
small punishment . they get to choose how serious to
make the case . 3 . the bos grown-up (
the judge ) : if someone get find guilty of
break a rule , the judge be the super bos
grown-up who get to choose what kind of `` time-out
'' or `` punishment '' they get . should it
be a little time-out ? a longer one ? what
do they have to do to make thing good ?
4 . the grown-ups who watch ( like probation or
parole officer ) : after someone get their punishment ,
sometimes grown-ups watch over them to make sure they 're
be good . these grown-ups can choose if someone have
be good enough to maybe get out of their punishment
earlier , or if they need to stay longer because
they 're still make bad choice . so , lot
of different grown-ups in the `` rule-following system '' get
to make important choice about what happen next , depend
on the situation ! that 's what discretion mean .
discretion in the criminal justice system refers to the power
to make choice among alternative course of action when decide
how to proceed with a case or situation . it
's exercise at nearly every level and stage , allow
for flexibility within the legal framework . the primary actor
who have significant discretion include : 1 . law enforcement
( police officer ) : decision to act : whether
to stop , question , investigate , or observe a
situation . arrest v . warning : decide whether to
make an arrest for an offense , issue a citation
, or simply give a warning . use of force
: determine the appropriate level of force in a give
encounter . reporting : how they document incident and gather
evidence . 2 . prosecutor ( district attorney , state
's attorney ) : charge decision : whether to file
charge , what specific charge to file ( e.g. ,
felony vs. misdemeanor , a less offense ) , and
how many charge . this be often see a the
most powerful form of discretion . plea bargaining : offering
defendant opportunity to plead guilty to lesser charge or for
reduced sentence . dismissal : deciding to drop charge even
after they have be file . sentence recommendation : advise
the court on appropriate sentence . 3 . judge :
pre-trial ruling : decision on bail , motion ( e.g.
, to suppress evidence ) , and schedule . trial
conduct : ruling on objection , admissibility of evidence ,
and jury instruction . sentencing : within statutory guideline ,
judge have significant discretion in determine the specific sentence (
e.g. , probation , fine , incarceration length , condition
of release ) . 4 . correctional official ( probation
and parole officer , prison administrator ) : probation/parole condition
: recommending and enforce the term of probation or parole
. revocation decision : decide whether to recommend revoke probation
or parole for violation . inmate management : prison administrator
and correctional officer make daily decision regard inmate classification ,
privilege , disciplinary action , and overall facility operation .
parole board : decide whether to grant an inmate early
release on parole . discretion be essential for the system
to adapt to diverse situation and achieve individualized justice ,
but it also present challenge relate to consistency , potential
bias , and the potential for abuse of power .
yes , lauren bacall do sing in her debut film
, `` to have and have not '' ( 1944

we know '' in a smoky , sultry style ,
which perfectly showcased her distinctive voice and cement her iconic
screen persona and undeniable chemistry with humphrey bogart . it
be a pivotal moment in the film and her career
. yes ! imagine a super cool lady name lauren
bacall . in her very first movie , `` to
have and have not , '' she sing a special
, grown-up kind of song . it be a very
smooth and soft song that make everyone think she be
super cool ! so , yes , she definitely sing
in that movie ! yes , lauren bacall do sing
in `` to have and have not '' ( 1944
) , her debut film . she famously perform the

, sultry scene that highlight her distinctive voice and instantly
establish her iconic screen presence and undeniable chemistry with humphrey
bogart . the t-bone steak be locate in the short
loin section of the cow . here 's a breakdown
: location : it come from the back of the
cow , specifically the area just behind the rib cage
and in front of the sirloin . the `` t
'' bone itself : the distinctive `` t '' shape
of the bone be actually a cross-section of a lumbar
vertebra , part of the cow 's spine . the
meat : what make the t-bone unique and highly desire
be that the bone separate two distinct and highly prize
cut of meat : on the large side of the
`` t '' bone be a piece of the strip
steak ( what 's often call a new york strip
when cut by itself ) . on the small side
of the `` t '' bone be a piece of
the tenderloin ( what 's often call a filet mignon
when cut by itself ) . porterhouse vs. t-bone :
often , people confuse t-bone and porterhouse . they be
essentially the same cut from the short loin , with
the key difference be the size of the tenderloin muscle
. a porterhouse steak be cut from the rear of
the short loin , where the tenderloin be large (
by usda standard , the tenderloin portion must be at
least 1.25 inch thick at it wide point ) .
a t-bone be cut from the front of the short
loin , where the tenderloin be small ( at least
0.5 inch thick at it wide point ) . okay
, imagine a cow be like a giant , yummy
animal for food ! the t-bone be a special piece
of meat that have a bone shape exactly like the
letter `` t '' inside it ! this `` t
'' bone come from the cow 's back , right
in the middle , kind of where you 'd put
a saddle if you be rid it . and the
super cool thing be , on each side of that

locate in the short loin section of the cow .
here 's a breakdown : general area : it come
from the back of the cow , specifically the area
between the rib ( where ribeyes come from ) and
the sirloin . the `` t '' bone : the
distinctive `` t '' shape of the bone be actually
a cross-section of a lumbar vertebra from the cow 's
spine . the meat : what make the t-bone (
and porterhouse ) so desirable be that the bone separate
two distinct and highly prized muscle : on the large
side of the `` t '' bone be a portion
of the strip loin muscle ( which , when cut
on it own , be know a a new york
strip ) . on the small side of the ``
t '' bone be a portion of the tenderloin muscle
( which , when cut on it own , be
know a a filet mignon or tenderloin steak ) .
so , when you eat a t-bone , you 're
get two different premium steak in one cut , separate
by that characteristic `` t '' shape bone . the
last name howard primarily originate from old english root .
it come from the old english give name hold-weard or
hof-weard . let 's break that down : hold (
or hof ) meant `` hall , '' `` enclosure
, '' or `` fortress . '' weard mean ``
guardian '' or `` warden . '' so , the
name essentially mean `` hall guardian '' or `` chief
warden . '' it likely refer to someone who be
responsible for guard or manage a hall , estate ,
or fortress . while the primary origin be old english
, there might have be some minor influence or mingling
with old norse name like hãâ¡varãâ°r ( 'high guardian '
) or early norman french form ( houard ) ,
but the old english explanation be the most widely accept
and direct . the name gain significant prominence and spread
due to the powerful howard family , particularly the duke
of norfolk , who become one of england 's leading
aristocratic family . their influence help solidify the surname 's
place . from england , it spread , like many
english surname , to ireland ( sometimes a an anglicized
form of gaelic name ) and then , with migration
, to the united state , canada , australia ,
and other english-speaking country . okay , imagine a super
long time ago , in a country call england !
the name howard be kind of like a job title
back then ! it come from two old word squish
together : one word mean a `` big , special
house '' ( like a castle or a very important
building ) . the other word mean `` the person
who look after it '' or the `` guard ''
. so , if your name be howard a long
, long time ago , it mean you be like
the `` guard of the special house '' or the
`` protector of the hall '' ! later , a
very important family , who be almost like king and
queen , have this name . and because they be
so famous and powerful , lot of other people start
use `` howard '' too , and it travel all
over the world ! the last name howard primarily originate
from old english . it be derive from the old
english give name hold-weard or hof-weard , which mean :

smith & wesson m & p shield 9mm ( and
it successor , the m & p shield plus )
be a striker-fired pistol . in term of action ,
striker-fired pistol like the m & p shield operate on
a principle that be often describe a a `` hybrid
'' or a `` pre-cocked double-action '' . here 's
why it 's not strictly single or double action in
the traditional sense : not true single action ( sa
) : a true sa require the hammer ( or
striker ) to be fully cock before the trigger be
pull , and the trigger pull only release the hammer/striker
. the shield do not have an external hammer ,
and the trigger pull do more than just release .
not true double action ( da ) : a true
da trigger pull fully cock the hammer/striker and then release
it . the shield 's trigger pull do n't do
the full cocking from an uncocked state . how it
work ( simplify ) : when a round be chamber
, the striker be partially cock by the slide 's
movement . the trigger pull then complete the cocking of
the striker and subsequently release it to fire the round
. this result in a relatively consistent trigger pull weight
and length for every shot , similar to a traditional
double-action , but with a lighter and short pull than
a full double-action-only ( dao ) system . therefore ,
while often list under `` striker-fired '' a it own
category , if you have to categorize it strictly a
single or double , it most closely approximate a light
, consistent `` double-action-only '' pull , but the industry
standard be to refer to it a `` striker-fired ''
due to it specific internal mechanism . okay , imagine
your toy dart gun ! a `` single action ''
dart gun be like when you have to pull back
the little hammer ( or the part that shoot )
first with your thumb , and then you pull the
trigger to make it shoot . two step ! a
`` double action '' dart gun be like when you
just pull the trigger all the way back , and
that one pull do both job ã¢ââ it pull the
hammer back and then shoot the dart . one long
pull ! now , the m & p shield 9mm
be a bit special . it 's like it do
half of the first step for you already ! when
you put a bullet in , the gun do half
of the `` pulling back the hammer '' part by
itself . then , when you pull the trigger ,
you do the rest of the `` pulling back ''
and it shoot ! so , it 's not exactly
like a simple `` single action '' or `` double
action '' toy gun . it 's kind of a
mix of both , but it feel like you just
pull the trigger and it go `` bang ! ''
every time , like a simple , light `` double
action . '' most grown-ups just call it a ``
striker-fired '' gun , which be it own special way
of work ! the smith & wesson m & p
shield 9mm ( and it variant like the shield plus
) be a striker-fired pistol . this mean it do
n't operate a a traditional single-action ( sa ) or
double-action ( da ) in the classic sense , which
usually refer to firearms with external hammer . here 's
a breakdown : not a true single action ( sa
) : a true sa pistol require the hammer (
or striker ) to be fully cock before the trigger
be pull , and the trigger pull merely release it
. the shield do n't work this way . not
a true double action ( da ) : a true
da trigger pull fully cock the hammer/striker and then release
it from an uncocked state . the shield do n't
do the full cocking from a completely at-rest position .
how it work ( striker-fired system ) : when you
rack the slide and chamber a round , the striker
be partially cock ( about 80-90 % of the way
back ) by the slide 's movement . the subsequent
trigger pull then complete the cocking of the striker the
remain small distance and then release it to fire the
round . this mechanism result in a consistent trigger pull
weight and length for every shot , which be often
describe a have a feel somewhat akin to a double-action-only
( dao ) pistol , but typically light and crisper
. so , while it action involve both cocking and
release the striker with one trigger pull ( similar to
the function of da ) , the precise internal mechanism
be distinct , and the industry standard classification be ``
striker-fired . '' the next world athletics championship ( the

cape may-lewes ferry go between cape may , new jersey
and lewes , delaware . it 's a passenger and
vehicle ferry that cross the mouth of the delaware bay
. okay , imagine a big , big boat ,
like a floating car park ! that 's the cape
may ferry . it 's like a bridge that float
on water . it start in a town call cape
may ( that 's in a place call new jersey
) . and it sail across a big bit of
water to a different town call lewes ( that 's
in a place call delaware ) . so , it
go from cape may to lewes , like a big
swim across the bay ! the cape may-lewes ferry go
between cape may , new jersey and lewes , delaware
. it provide a connection across the mouth of the
delaware bay for both vehicle and passenger . in the
united state , the authority to formally declare war on
another country rest solely with congress . this power be
explicitly grant to the legislative branch in article i ,
section 8 , clause 11 of the u.s. constitution ,
which state that congress shall have the power `` to
declare war . '' while the president act a the
commander-in-chief of the armed force and can direct military action
and deploy troop , they do not have the constitutional
authority to declare war . president have , however ,
initiate numerous military conflict without a formal declaration of war
from congress ( e.g. , korea , vietnam , the
gulf war , afghanistan , iraq ) . okay ,
imagine our country be like a really big classroom ,
and sometimes it might get into a really big argument
( a war ! ) with another classroom ( another
country ) . who get to say , `` okay
, we 're go to have a big fight now
! '' ? it 's not just one person !
it 's a special group of grown-ups call congress .
think of congress like the big group of decision-makers for
the whole country . they talk about it very carefully
and all have to agree together that it 's okay
to have a war . the president ( who be
like the bos of the army ) can suggest it
, and he lead the army if congress say ``
yes . '' but congress be the one who have
to say the final , big `` yes , we
declare war ! '' in the united state , the
authority to formally declare war on another country rest solely
with congress . this power be explicitly grant to the
legislative branch in article i , section 8 , clause
11 of the u.s. constitution , which state that congress
shall have the power `` to declare war . ''
while the the president be the commander-in-chief of the armed
force and can direct military action and deploy troop ,
they do not have the constitutional power to unilaterally declare
war . historically , many u.s. military engagement have occur
without a formal declaration of war , rely instead on
congressional authorization of military force or the president 's executive
